results.description:
Please join us for our weekly gathering!

Please enter the space quietly so that we can support the meditation of the prior class in session. Feel free to bring snacks for the after hours tea party.


We hope to see you there!

Typical evening schedule: 
20 Minutes Seated Meditation 
10 Min Walking Meditation 
10 Min Reading 
30 Min Sharing Circle 
Tea And Snacks till closing @ 11pm

We are a young adult group (Under 35) practicing mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.
results.how_to_find_us: near Union Sq.  Use South Entrance, and take elevator to 2nd floor
results.name: Arrive in the present moment

group.name: Wake Up New York - Meditation and Mindfulness

results.description:
It is possible to live a life of miracles when we are slightly willing to give up all the negative layers in our mind in favor of positive, loving paradigms. While it doesn't mean that everything is going to be perfect, our power to experience happiness, peace, and miracles will be multiplied and the world will not impact our center of light as much.
I want 2016 to be your most powerful year yet. Every year is only going to be getter for you if you commit yourself to that anchoring belief.
In this lecture, we will get clear on our highest intention for 2016 and new practices that will bring about miracles all year-long.

Suggested donation: $10
results.name: MAKE 2016 A YEAR OF MIRACLES!

results.description:
“I had the vegan enchiladas and the jalapeño margarita, both were amazing.” - one review on Yelp

Maizal Restaurant, opened a little over a year ago, has been recommended by a couple other VegAstorians. The menu contains a small Vegetarian Section:


http://www.maizalrestaurant.com/#!menus/c1k0f


To be clear though, there's only one vegan item on the menu (the enchiladas), though Lindsay says they'll make some dishes vegan for you. They'd better Lindsay, they'd better!

If you are free on Friday the 15th, then please join us for dinner and those very interesting jalapeno margaritas. Sounds like a good way to warm up in the midst on Winter!

A few reminders: 
- If your plans change for the evening, please update your RSVP with enough lead time for me to change our reservation. 
- Please show up on time.
results.name: DINNER: Maizal Mexican Cuisine

Come Join Us For A Mixer Party @ Mr Gs! A MULTI-GROUP EVENT!

This is a recently opened venue in the heart of the Meadowlands. Completely renovated and ready for us to chill, socialize, and party at.

We'll have a reserved area on the 1st floor with some nice couches, TVs, dance floor, and a beautiful Pool Table as well (Free To Play). Bar available for drinks as well as a food menu for ordering.

Management is also allowing access to the gorgeous 2ND FLOOR VIP AREA WITH VELVET COUCHES & PRIVATE POOL TABLES for our members. Do Note It May Be Unavailable After 10pm If Another Party Rents It Out.

DJ Music Scheduled To Start At About 10pm. Expect To Hear A Nice Club Mix Of Top 40, Classics, & More.

ICEBREAKER MATCH GAME FROM 8PM TO 10PM. EACH GUY AND LADY WILL RECEIVE A CARD, FIND THE PERSON OF THE OPPOSITE GENDER WITH THE MATCHING CARD AND THE LADY WILL WIN A FUN PRIZE. (WHILE PRIZES LAST)


DOORS OPEN AT 8PM.

$5 ENTRY WHICH IS GOOD TIL 10PM. MENTION MEETUP AT THE DOOR.

YOU'LL RECEIVE A HANDSTAMP OR WRISTBAND TO HAVE ACCESS TO OUR RESERVED AREAS AND SELECT DRINK & FOOD SPECIALS TIL 10PM.

SPECIALS: $6 FOR HOUSE VODKA DRINK - $5.99 FOR CHICKEN WINGS OR CHEESE QUESADILLA APPETIZERS.


Free Parking Til 9pm. "Mention Meetup" If Attendant Is Present.

$5 Reduced Parking Fee From 9pm To 10pm. MUST MENTION MEETUP.

$10 Parking Fee After 10pm For All Cars.

Dress Code Is Business Casual, It's An Upscale Place: Nice Jeans Ok And Nice Shoes. Avoid Baggy Clothing & Work Boots.

results.description:
GET YOUR TICKETS HERE!

In 2016 the CHA is launching a new initiative called GrowUp.NYC which is a coalition to legalize cannabis in New York. In the spirit of this coalition we have launched a partnership with none other than the legendary New York City recording and rehearsal studio known as Funkadelic Studios.

Funkadelic Studios is extremely supportive of our movement and has played host to our association this past May for the "Gotham City Ganjafest" event. We are so excited to be able to bring Funkadelic Studios back into the mix as the Launchpad for our coalition.

The purpose of this event is to help inspire activism in the tri-state area. We at the CHA believe that lawful access to cannabis is a sacred right and to be deprived of it is unacceptable. That said, we also believe that people are generally "scared" of true, legitimate activism. The GrowUp.NYC coalition is not just about telling our oppressive leaders in the state to grow up, it's also about helping the passionate and talented people in the cannabis movement to legalize get more involved with the state. Together we hope to inspire more phone calls to public officials, lobbying efforts at the state houses, letters written, and meetings with our states legislature that are both credible and responsible. The CHA is very concerned that cannabis activists are perceived as mindless stoners by the media and our public officials due to the radical tactics of many in the movement. While civil disobedience can be fun and sometimes impactful, the stigmas we are left with as a community can be a setback to the patients in dire need of medical cannabis.

There  is one simple rule for this event that is very reasonable.

Pipes, edibles, and vapes only. No bongs, rigs, joints, or blunts. Simple matter of mitigating the smoke a request from the venue. Please respect.

We have some incredible performers and speakers that will be on hand.

Now casting....please let us know if you want to speak at the event or perform. We will get the details out.
results.how_to_find_us: Follow the smoke and vapor trails!
results.name: GrowUp.NYC Launch Event (Activism Night)

results.description:
New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 

****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Continuing Momentum) w/Nicole Marie Markley and Michael Larson Ramirez 
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics ("Shake that Thang!") w/ Sarah Elise 
9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/ Neil Benen and Sarah Elise

Stepping Out Studios is located at 37 West 26th St, 9th Floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the keypad to the right of the building entrance.

****************************************************************************

Wow... last Friday sure was hoppin'! If your New Year's resolution was to dance more, it seems that you're not the only one. Some of our favorite dancers were lighting up the dance floor. Winter, shminter... we don't care!

Don't miss out this week on special guest instructor and DJ Sarah Elise, visiting us from Boston!
Sarah Elise is a dedicated Blues dancer who is a teacher in real life, and brings her dynamic classroom style to teaching dance. She regularly teaches blues in Boston, and has taught at local dances around the country. A participant in the inaugural year of The Blues Experiment, Sarah Elise has a whole slew of ideas and games up her sleeve to make your dancing feel oh-so-good! 

****************************************************************************

JANUARY EXTENDED TOPICS:

"That's My Jam!"Everyone has something they just love. That move, that song, that style that they just can’t stop doing! Come join us for a month of classes - each taught by a different instructor - to learn what inspires them. Use their inspiration to help fuel yours!

This Week: "Shake that Thang! " with Sarah Elise
Do you want hips that just won't quit? It's a lot more than just shakin' that thang. In this hip-focused solo class, we will examine some familiar basics and take a closer look at how to come up with some new hip movements of our own. Learn how to use your hips to accent your dancing, enhance your musicality, and take on the world!

Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 30 to 60 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (sorry, cash only). But if you pay for both at the same time, it's just $20 for the night! 

Volunteers get in for FREE for the night! Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

If you see or experience anything that would be considered harmful activity or a breach of etiquette, please speak with our Manager. The Manager on Duty this week is Melissa S Cohen.
results.how_to_find_us: https://www.facebook.com/BluesDanceNewYork/events

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON Brooklyn

results.description:
Join us for 'Digital Age Fashion' Drawing Session at The National Arts Club! 


This session is open to sketchers of all levels from beginners to pros!

This is a great chance to meet others in our group, hang out in an amazing environment (see below), listen to a wonderful DJ and of course create great work! There will also be a bar where you can buy a drink.

We will have two models to draw from. Watercolor, color pencil and odorless  markers are welcome. 

We will drawing in the Grand Gallery at The National Arts club one of the most historic and iconic arts buildings in New York City. (the room seen here.)

If you have any questions please feel free to email me. 


Thank you.

Simon

results.description:
Buy Tickets Here

Formed in 2008, Red Baraat is a pioneering eight-piece band from Brooklyn, New York. Conceived by dhol player Sunny Jain, the group has drawn worldwide praise for its singular sound — a merging of hard driving North Indian Bhangra and Sufi rhythms with elements of go-go, rock and jazz. Created with no less a purposeful agenda than manifesting joy and unity in all people, Red Baraat’s spirit is worn brightly on its sweaty and hard-worked sleeve. And is being returned to them in cities all over the world, as word spreads of the band’s incredibly powerful live performances.

Buy Tickets Here


With a new EP slated for 2016, Livewire, a 5 track scorcher recorded in-studio at Seattle’s KEXP demonstrates a band that thirsts for evolution. While still retaining many of the propulsive and uplifting musical elements that fired their previous albums, Livewire brings a new sound to the band with the addition of guitar, as well as dhol and sousaphone processed effects.

Buy Tickets Here



 The release of their 2nd album in 2012, Shruggy Ji, which debuted at #1 on the Billboard World Music charts and led NPR to famously dub Red Baraat “The best party band in years,” propelled the band on a three-year world tour that included performances at Bonnaroo, Austin City Limits, Monterey Jazz Festival and WOMAD, along with clubs, theatres, and arts centers. Along the way, they sold out rooms as diverse as the Luxembourg Philharmonic and the Bowery Ballroom, and performed at the request of The White House, Peter Gabriel, TED, and the Olympic Games.

Friday, January 15, 2016

9:00 PM

Le Poisson Rouge
<a href="https://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&hl=en&q=158+Bleecker+Street%2C+New+York%2C+NY%2C+10012%2C+us"></a> 158 Bleecker Street
(Bet. Sullivan and Thompson Sts.)
New York, NY

You MUST RSVP to play. Message me on Meetup or text/call me (Dan) at[masked] if you have any questions or RSVP issues. If you're not on the 'going' list, it means you're not signed up.

results.description:
Last Friday's class was so great. We had about 20 people taking the class and they did very well. We are back this Friday with another class and social. If you missed my Progressive Salsa class this past Wednesday Jan 13th, then you can come and take the class at La Fama. I will be reviewing the basic steps we learned Wednesday so that you catch up and are ready for next week's class, which will be all about basics and demystifying turns. We will drill and drill and drill basics and turns with slow music, medium speed, and fast speed music. And i will try to get a bigger room. If you did attend, then come to Fama to practice and ask me any questions you may have. either way, La Fama is the place to be this Friday.

Class: The class is free with admission. It begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic steps, how to hold your partner, how to be on time with the music, and so on. You do not need to bring a dance partner since we rotate students so you get to practice with everyone else. But do bring your friends and have a blast. After the class, dance all night with all the people you met during the class. The instructor will usually be Silvio Neris.

Admission: $10. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.
results.name: La Fama Salsa Social + Free class after Admission

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE

We’re back at the Bohemian Beer Hall with a special 80’s/90’s themed, indoor party night, so we can quietly throw it back to that old school feel! Come out and dress up as your favorite 80’s or 90’s music or TV characters like Miami Vice, MC Hammer, Flavor Fav, Spice Girls, etc; Think outside the box! The event kicks off at 10pm when the headphones go on and DJs take the stage. They’ll be spinning everything to keep you singing, drinking and dancing till 2am!
3 DJs Spinning Live:
Green Channel: Old School Music Videos
Red DJ: 90s Pop/Rock/Dance hits
Blue DJ: Old School 90s Hip Hop and R&B

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Costumes are NOT mandatory but are encouraged.
This party is indoors
Age Restriction: 21+
All Tickets Are Limited, So Get Them ASAP!

HOW IT WORKS

***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJs with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: Old School 80s/90s Theme Party

Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.

BUY TICKETS HERE

We’re back at the Bohemian Beer Hall with a special 80’s/90’s themed, indoor party night, so we can quietly throw it back to that old school feel! Come out and dress up as your favorite 80’s or 90’s music or TV characters like Miami Vice, MC Hammer, Flavor Fav, Spice Girls, etc; Think outside the box! The event kicks off at 10pm when the headphones go on and DJs take the stage. They’ll be spinning everything to keep you singing, drinking and dancing till 2am!
3 DJs Spinning Live:
Green Channel: Old School Music Videos
Red DJ: 90s Pop/Rock/Dance hits
Blue DJ: Old School 90s Hip Hop and R&B

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Costumes are NOT mandatory but are encouraged.
This party is indoors
Age Restriction: 21+
All Tickets Are Limited, So Get Them ASAP!

***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJs with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.

Best dang comedy show in the city, baby. 

Come to Chelsea in Manhattan, hang out, have some brews, and enjoy a hilarious show (with pizza after, hey-o!)

There's no door charge and you don't have to buy a drink. Meet new people, or bring your own pals, it's a great time from start to finish. 

Here's what people are saying about standup.NYC:

"I was blown away at the talent." 

"Great time and solid pizza, but be sure to ask for it at the end of the show, Dan and Danny will hook you up." 

"Laid back vibe, perfect for seeing some funny people, hanging out with friends, and only spending as much money as you want to drink"

***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.

results.description:
When a young girl is found hanging in the local church with fang marks in her neck, the townsfolk immediately suspect Dracula (Christopher Lee) is behind the evil deed. Although he has supposedly been dead for quite some time, the vile vampire is the prime suspect. The Monsignor (Rupert Davies) is called in to exorcise the local castle where Dracula once lived. The diabolical Dracula forces the holy man's assistant to help him in his thirst for blood. His next victim is the Monsignor's niece, who works at the local pub. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6LHuFfGmWc0

results.description:
Welcome to Early Bird English, the fun and interesting way to improve your conversation skills early in the day -- without cutting into the rest of your weekend!

 Leader Eve will supply plenty to discuss, but feel free to bring along an English-language passage that you have enjoyed or found puzzling. We'll all take a look and discuss what it means.

 Early Bird English is founded on the idea that people learn best when they are enjoying themselves. Each session is quickly paced, friendly, and meant to challenge.

Eve charges a small, non-refundable fee for each session, which helps to cover the cost of the website as well as her preparation.   Please note that the $10 fee DOES NOT cover the cost of coffee!  Please also note that if only one person attends (in addition to Eve), the meeting will last one hour instead of 1.5.

http://thejoyofenglish.org/

When we learn with pleasure, we never forget.

-- Alfred Mercier

"Lenovo is one of a growing number of multinationals from the non-Anglophone world that have made English their official language."

-- The Economist, 2/15/14

"A strong vocabulary may be your ticket to side-stepping dementia," says a new study from researchers in Spain.  "...An ample vocab is an indication of robust cognitive reserves, a surplus of neurons that help the brain compensate for memory lapses..." 

-- Prevention, April 2015

"It might have been easier to learn a language years ago, but still, I'm having fun...I was heartened to see, just a month or so ago, a Penn State study suggesting that learning a new language can improve your brain function.  It can, in the researcher's words, 'lead to more graceful aging.'" 

-- Tina Hay, editor, The Penn Stater, March/April 2015

"The average American speaks one language.  Be more than average."

-- magazine ad for Rosetta Stone

results.description: In 2014, we began a Miracle Call to lift our prayers, wishes and desires into the divine realm of pure consciousness, which we call God. results.description: Let's enjoy running alongside the pier taking in the beautiful NYC skyline. It's a very peaceful, serene run. We will meet and warm up by the lawn. All paces welcome, even fast walkers. I encourage you to bring a friend as the group will spread out based on individual levels. I'd like for all runners/walkers to set a minimum goal of 3 miles. The group leader will likely do 8-10 miles. Your pace your distance.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

 

Art of Living Secaucus Center

Phone: <a>[masked]</a>
Meetup: <a>http://www.meetup.com/Lets-Meditate-Secaucus/</a>;
Twitter: https://twitter.com/#secaucusaol
Web: http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/secaucus

You can choose to pay $15 for a drop in class or take advantage of our 'class pass.' 3 classes for $40 or 5 classes for $60.

results.description:
UPDATE:  DECEMBER 23, 2015

Hi Ladies!  Please note that RSVPing via Meetup does not get you a ticket inside the BSidesNYC venue. To attend, you must register through EventBrite.


The second round of tickets for BSidesNYC will open on Tuesday, January 5th, 2016 at 12:00pm ET and will be limited to 200, one ticket per person. Tickets are 100% free. Donations are entirely optional, but appreciated. Registration is on a first-come, first-served system. 


To attend, you must register through EventBrite. https://www.eventbrite.com/e/bsidesnyc-2016-tickets-18966494295?aff=eac2


The first round of tickets was through EventBrite.  I am assuming that the second round will also be through EventBrite.


Please sign up with EventBrite so that you are ready on January 5th to register for your ticket.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/bsidesnyc-2016-tickets-18966494295?aff=eac2

=============================


Hi Ladies!

It's almost time for the inaugural BSidesNYC conference so mark your calendars!

Sat, Jan 16, 2016 at 8:30 AM
BSidesNYC 2016
John Jay College of Criminal Justice, New York, NY


BSides NYC is an Information / Security conference that’s different. It is a 100% volunteer organized event, put on by and for the community, and truly strives to keep information free. Also cool news: WSC is a partner organization!

When:
Saturday, January 16, 2016 from 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM (EST)


Where:
John Jay College of Criminal Justice - 524 West 59th Street New York, NY 10019


The full venue can be found at the following link:
https://bsidesnyc.org/venue/

The following link with how to register:
https://bsidesnyc.org/registration/

To attend, you must register through EventBrite. First round of tickets are already sold out so keep watching the site for the next round!

We hope to see you all there again and please help us spread the word to anyone who you think may be interested.

See you in January!

Pamela Dean, WSC NY

Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation: 

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

Kicking off the 2016 hiking season with Millbrook Mountain, Gertrude's Nose and Lake Minnewaska in Minnewaska State Park (AMC rating of 4B12). The leader is normally hibernating by now, but decided to take a full advantage of exceptionally warm winter and continue hiking until we actually get snowed in (if we ever do, that is).

On the way back after the hike, we will swing by a microbrewery, winery or distiller in the vicinity of Minnewaska State Park. The participants will get to vote for their choice… making this trip customizable for your own taste! In case of a split decision, the leader will make the final call.

results.description:
This looks like a great find!

From http://www.green-wood.com/

"Founded in 1838 and now a National Historic Landmark, Green-Wood was one of the first rural cemeteries in America. By the early 1860s, it had earned an international reputation for its magnificent beauty and became the prestigious place to be buried, attracting 500,000 visitors a year, second only to Niagara Falls as the nation’s greatest tourist attraction. Crowds flocked there to enjoy family outings, carriage rides, and sculpture viewing in the finest of first generation American landscapes. Green-Wood’s popularity helped inspire the creation of public parks, including New York City’s Central and Prospect Parks.

Green-Wood is 478 spectacular acres of hills, valleys, glacial ponds and paths, throughout which exists one of the largest outdoor collections of 19th- and 20th-century statuary and mausoleums. Four seasons of beauty from century-and-a-half-old trees offer a peaceful oasis to visitors, as well as its 560,000 permanent residents, including Leonard Bernstein, Boss Tweed, Charles Ebbets, Jean-Michel Basquiat, Louis Comfort Tiffany, Horace Greeley, Civil War generals, baseball legends, politicians, artists, entertainers and inventors.

A magnet for history buffs and bird watchers, Green-Wood is a Revolutionary War historic site (the Battle of Long Island was fought in 1776 across what is now its grounds), a designated site on the Civil War Discovery Trail and a registered member of the Audubon Cooperative Sanctuary System"

We will meet at the Joppa/Fallston Park & Ride (I-95, 74.0mm) at 9am. From there we will drive (carpooling highly encouraged!) to the Staten Island Ferry Terminal (all-day parking $7; Ferry is free). We will take the Ferry across New York Harbor, passing the Statue of Liberty, and Governor's and Ellis Islands, on route to Whitehall Terminal on the southern tip of Manhattan. There, we will catch the R train on the subway out to the 25th Street Station in Brooklyn, then walk a generous block to the cemetery. We will return the same way, but many of you may want to get off the train at the Brooklyn Bridge stop and walk across the bridge from Brooklyn into Manhattan for what is, I believe, the very best vantage point for the New York City skyline.

Plan on returning to the Joppa/Fallston Park & Ride sometime between 8pm and 10pm, depending on if you stay for dinner and/or sightseeing in the City.
results.name: ROAD TRIP:  Green-Wood Cemetery, Brooklyn, NYC

There will also be a livestream at https://livestream.com/internetsociety/wikidaynyc2016

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

results.description:
Just putting this on the calendar in a recurring fashion to allow for people to plan ahead and see if we can make more people intersect.

These will be mostly (unless highlighted) in Watching Reservation, but may occasionally detour to Loantaka, Washington Park, South Mountain and so one. 

In every case, the idea will be to be at that location at 9:30, and to be done at the very last at 10:30. Carpooling may be organized in some cases (via the FB group for efficiency). The trail will be decided when we leave. Whatever strikes our fancy, take a look at past meetups to get a sense. No runner left behind as I will be at back panting heavily anyway. 

If you're wondering wether you're up for a 1 hour run - let us know and we can shorten it or make sure we set our pace adequately. The idea is to enjoy ourselves and nature, not to set any speed records.

Note that this is a member-run meetup: no one is responsible for you but you. Your event host is not responsible for you or any injuries that could happen as you willingly run across rough terrain with roots, rocks, gullies, etc. Don't expect anyone to have first aid knowledge, supplies, or water for you. Just a bunch of like-minded people enjoying the trails together! For more details see section 6.2 of http://www.meetup.com/terms/

venue.name: Stanley Isaacs Senior Center

results.description:
This volunteer opportunity helps a segment of the NYC population that is particularly vulnerable (our home-bound seniors) and is facing a steadily growing problem - hunger. As our city’s elderly grow older, they are more likely to have mobility limitations, while living at or below the poverty level. The elderly of East Harlem are particularly more vulnerable, residing in challenging living conditions alone, and who can no longer shop or cook for themselves.

Citymeals-on-Wheels (www.citymeals.org) raises private funds to ensure no homebound elderly New Yorker will ever go a day without food or human company. Citymeals funds 33 community-based agencies that bring weekend, holiday and emergency meals to homebound elderly New Yorkers - one of the agencies we'll be helping as volunteers.

How are we helping?

On Saturday, January 16th, we'll assist the Stanley Isaacs Senior Center Citymeals-on-Wheels program with delivery of meals to the elderly. Volunteers should wear weather appropriate clothes and comfortable shoes as deliveries are done on foot within walking distance from the meal center.  Although the weather may not always be favorable, the meals MUST be delivered as many, if not all, of the elderly in the program RELY on the meal delivery for the day.

Our Meetup

We'll meet at the Senior Center at 9:30am on Saturday for a short training, then break into small teams of 3 to 4 people to deliver the meals to the elderly. A light breakfast of juice, coffee, pastry and/or bagels will be offered.

If you RSVP, please try to be on time, or arrive no later than 9:30am, which is when we start delivery. The time commitment ends at 12pm and goes by very quickly. 

If you have any questions, running late, need more information on parking and etc., feel free to call/text Daniel at 774.275.3646.

Directions to the Union Settlement Senior Center

The Stanley Isaacs Senior Center is located at 415 East 93rd Street. The closest subway is the #6 train to 96th Street & Lexington Avenue, then walking east to 93rd street & 1st Avenue. Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
We invite you to join us for a one day Tensegrity® class on Saturday, January 16th 10:00am-5:30pm.  The theme of the class is Honoring Our Partners - Past and Present.  We will meet at Keystone Dance Studio, located at 252 West 30th Street #4B in Manhattan.  The exchange is $70.00.  There will be a break for lunch from 1:00-2:30.  Please bring a notebook and pen with you.  Mats for sitting on will be provided by the studio.

Through Tensegrity® movement, theatrical play, and self-inquiry, we will:

Grow in empathy of our partner – past or current – by playing scenes about them in the Theater of Infinity®, where we will first adopt the role of ourselves, them, then ourselves again, inspired and renewed;

Neutralize fluctuating, and often conflicting, complaints we may have about our partner;

Determine what traits we share with our loved one in order to acknowledge, share responsibility, and/or crystallize the purity of our past or present bond;

Take part in a ‘ceremony of renewal,’ where we will understand what this particular bond meant and why we came together, so as to release any unnecessary elements and intend forward new life for all involved.

Our partners are some of the most important people in our lives. We make some of our strongest commitments with them, depend upon them as we do no other, and are often willing to go the ‘extra mile’ for them.

Our ‘partners’ can take different forms; they have been and can be a special plant and animal, as well as a human being. For the purpose of this class, we will be focusing on our human partners now.

Carlos Castaneda’s teacher, don Juan Matus, corroborates this unique union by describing energetically what happens between partners:

… the emanations encased inside the cocoon of both partners undergo a profound agitation, the culminating point of which is a merging, a fusing of two pieces of their glow of awareness, one from each partner…

In other words, partnering creates a ‘third’ entity, whether that takes the form of a child, a binding philosophy, a shared appreciation, a lasting creative project, and/or a common goal.

Being in continuous, close proximity with another human being provides a wealth of opportunity for perceptual depth and growth.

If we take the less conscious road of forming judgments, assumptions, and conclusions about our loved one, we build distance and remain in the cocoon of ourselves.

If we practice acceptance of the ebbs and flows of our partner’s journey, as well as our own, and remind ourselves that we both are on a tour of awareness in this life – of learning, expanding beyond our limitations, and exploring new avenues for change – then the ‘we’ we first formed can fully unfold.

To take part in this class series, you need not be in a current relationship. It will be your choice to focus on a past or current partnership, knowing that what we process from our history, carries forward to our present and future.

Let’s expand beyond our often narrow and confining view we have of our partners. In freeing them, we free ourselves!

Warmly,
Eliana & Nat
results.how_to_find_us: Please contact us at nyintent@gmail.com or 917-498-1071
results.name: Tensegrity® Class: Honoring Our Partners - Past and Present

Registrants have access for 6 months to an archived video of the entire event (helpful if you'd like to see the sessions on a day other than a Saturday, although you won't be able to participate in live Q&A).


The current lineup can be found at: http://iot.withthebest.com/ 
Speakers from IoT NY and friends of the meetup will be leading sessions, as well as other IoT leaders from the US, Europe and India.


Steps to attend:

1. RSVP Yes here on the IoT NY meetup event page if interested in attending
2. On Tue, 12/23, 50 IoT NY members who RSVP'd yes on this meetup page will be randomly selected to receive a discount code to attend the event for free. 
3. After 12/23, a discount code for a $12.50 ticket will be posted (see comments below for the code). That code is valid for up to 180 IoT NY members who register on the event site. (So, if you weren't contacted on 12/23 with a free code, you should RSVP here on the meetup event page *and* register on the event site with the discount code provided).
4. Register at http://iot.withthebest.com/ and use your discount code. You must register on this site in order to attend with discount code. 
5. Tune in for all or part of the full-day conference on Saturday, January 16 (link provided once you register)

We'll resume with an in-person meetup in February and can also trade notes then on the different topics presented.

results.description:
LEADER: Jeffrey Sovelove ([masked])

RATING: B 6 B

Leader’s choice of trails depending on conditions at Jockey Hollow National Park in Morristown. See www.nps.gov/morr/planyourvisit/directions.htm for directions and information. Bring lots of water, a snack, wear hiking boots, and come prepared for winter hiking i.e., traction devices, no cotton, and layers. Meet at the visitors’ center at 10 AM. Heavy/steady rain cancels. Joint ADK/Sierra Club hike.

* * * * * *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities. Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance.

Pace Ratings:
A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster
B = Moderate - about 2 mph
C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less

Distance: Noted in miles

Terrain Ratings:
A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, possible rock scrambling
B = Moderate climbs and descents
C = Generally flat with little elevation change

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling.

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike.

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

Risks: As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

Footwear and Clothing: Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes. Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

Drink and Food: Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

Other responsibilities: Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them. Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian. No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21. The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike. Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

Maps: The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

Abbreviations: NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

Expense Sharing: When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

Dog-Friendly Hikes: Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly." If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.
results.name: Jockey Hollow Leader’s Choice

results.description: Join experts from your L.L.Bean Paramus Park Mall Retail Store for an easy bird-watching hike along Celery Farm's loop trail. With a multitude of observation towers built for bird watching scattered around this park, this trail provides plenty of opportunity to look for birds who use this local estuary as a stopping point on their migration path or as their everyday home. Make sure you bring your binoculars and a camera to maximize your experience. Weather appropriate hiking clothing (layers; no cotton) and waterproof footwear (if possible) are highly recommended. You may even want to bring a small day pack with extra clothes, lunch, snacks, water and any personal medications you may need. Ages 8 and up are welcome. The parking area is small, so carpooling is highly recommended. If the parking area is full, more parking can be found by the nearby A&P shopping center, which is only a short walk away. Hope to see you on the trail!

This walk will feature the talents of AMC stalwart and Park Slopian Rachel Radin, who will lead us around Prospect Park in a debut performance. Thanks also to Robin Sitzer for suggesting we do a route like this. Dress warmly and bring water. The lunch stop will be on the late side, so bringing something to munch on is a good idea. results.description:
Let's start by meeting in the American Wing Cafe for a quick round of intros over coffee.

Next, we'll take turns leading the group to 1 or 2 of our favorite works of art in the Met.  Instead of saying, "I love it, because the blue is so great," you'll explain why you connect with that particular piece.  What resonates for you?  How does it make you feel?

You may present us with factual background about the artwork but, ultimately, the goal is to share something personal.  If it helps to bring along any visual aids, feel free.


Here are a couple of examples of Met videos that illustrate what I'm striving for.


http://82nd-and-fifth.metmuseum.org/atmospheric

http://www.metmuseum.org/connections/texture

This meetup is for people who are already familiar with the Met.   Prior to the meetup, please visit the Met's web site to confirm the location of your artwork(s) and to make sure the art is indeed on view.


Attendees are responsible for paying for their museum admission and for any purchases from the cafe.  Suggested admission is $25, but you may pay what you wish.  The desk staff will accept any amount cheerfully. 


If something comes up and you can't attend, please change your RSVP status as soon as possible.  Given the small size of this meetup group, no-show's would be a big loss.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the American Wing Cafe, Charles Engelhard Court, first floor.  Look for table with red Meetup sign.
results.name: Share Your Favorite Art, to Connect at the Met

results.description:
WE WILL READ BOTH PLAYS TODAY

We will start at 1030 AM with The Brothers Menaechmus by Titus Maccius Plautus (c. 254 – 184 BC)

This is the play that William Shakepeare based THE COMEDY OF ERRORS ON

We will read that later in the afternoon after a break.

It is one of the shortest of his plays.

You can come for both or simply one.

Please bring food and drink to share and copies of the play

I will have several copies of the play by Plautus available.

We will also read Terence and Seneca throughout the spring. This we will do before we hit the Greeks


We will read other plays by Plautus throughout the spring...note they are really funny !!!!!

The version we will use for these reads of Plautus is


Four Comedies: The Braggart Soldier; The Brothers Menaechmus; The Haunted House; The Pot of Gold (Oxford World's Classics) Paperback – June 15, 2008
by Plautus (Author), Erich Segal (Translator)

http://www.amazon.com/Four-Comedies-Braggart-Brothers-Menaechmus/dp/019954056X/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1450560625&sr=8-3&keywords=plautus

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

group.name: The Indigo Papillon- A Center For Wisdom and Enlightenment

results.description:
We convincingly showed last week that decoherece eliminates the need for wave function collapse, but also concluded that measurement of quantum systems is a highly irreversible process.  This week we will talk about entropy, both classical and quantum, and their relationship to the inexorable, unidirectional flow of time.  Why, apart from the practical intractability of so many degrees of freedom, do we see macroscopic process as irreversible when the microscopic laws of physics work just as well one way in time as the other? How does entropy manifest itself in quantum mechanics, and how is it related to information and entanglement?

I will introduce the classical concept of entropy in Equilibrium Thermodynamics and Statistical Mechanics, starting with Liousville's Theorem and Boltzmann's probabilistic explanation for the apparent forward flow of time. If time, I will mention Jayne's subjectivist view of entropy and the maximum entropy principle.

Jeff will then discuss the quantum analogue of entropy, the Von Neumann entropy and introduce Entanglement Entropy. Then briefly discuss Quantum Field Theory at finite temperature.

We will record the meetup if anyone has access to some recording equipment (?)

The math will be moderate...at the level of early undergraduate.

Some readings below...

Gentle Overview

http://www.exactlywhatistime.com/the-arrow-of-time/

Self-contained introduction to Statistical Physics in Equilibrium

http://itp.uni-frankfurt.de/~valenti/WS13-14/all_1314_chap7.pdf


Von Neumann Entropy 

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Von_Neumann_entropy


https://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~vazirani/s07quantum/notes/qinfo.pdf


http://wwwmpa.mpa-garching.mpg.de/~ensslin/Lectures/2011-1/SeminarTalks/SeminarQuantumInformation.pdf

Quantum Decoherence and The Arrow of Time

http://arxiv.org/pdf/quant-ph/0701225v1.pdf
results.name: Entropy, Information  and the Arrow of Time

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked]

Stay warm and ride the rails of the NYC Subway System in Manhattan as we bring dozens of Meet Up and Social Networking Groups together for a little fun competition, exploring, socializing even a little learning.  No experience is necessary all you need is a desire to have fun and meet new people!

How it works:

-Registration will happen at 11am at St Pat's Bar and Grill located at 22  west 46th between 5th and 6th.

-We will randomly put together teams of 4- 5 (unless you already have a team)

-Once you are on a team you will be given a sheet of clues and questions where the only places you can find the answers are within the trains and stations of the Manhattan subways. Many of the clues will focus on finding historical info as well as the subway art within the stations (It's not hard stuff, we promise and you will be told which specific station to go to!!)

-Each team will be given a designated amount of time (2 hours) from when they leave to return with as many answers as possible.

-After all teams have returned the groups will come together for food, drinks socializing and sharing experiences while we tally up the results!  The final destination will be selected that day. (near Penn Station)

What kind of stuff will we be looking for? You will be given the specific clues to find at each station and in the subway cars.  Many of the clues will will involve historical elements and the art exhibits in the stations. You will also have to bring back some pictures, trinkets and "trash" from your adventure.  All in good fun.

Can I come alone?  Yes 95% of those attending will likely sign up on their own.  If you come alone we will set you up on a fun team.

How should I dress?  Casual and for the weather although y0u will be underground 98% of the time.

What is the cost?  $10 to participate in the Scavenger Hunt, plus you may need to swipe your metro card 2-3 times. Please bring exact change.

What should I bring?  A camera phone if you have one.  If not no worries.  Bottle of water.

Where will I be traveling to?  You will be traveling on several of the subway lines, transferring trains and exploring some stations. All of the hunt will take place on the subways between 59th street and South Ferry.
results.name: The Great Subways and Stations Art & History Scavenger Hunt

results.description:
New Years Resolutions Come True

Let's start off the year with good people, healthy food and a healing spirit.

During this Lupie Lunch, we are going to meet in a private area of a meditation center, have a 15 minutes breathing/calming meditation, followed by a 15 minutes Bata meditation that is designed specifically to bring healing to people suffering from illness, and receive a special blessing to protect us from illness. 

LIMTED SEATS - RSVP NOW!!!


We will meet at 11AM, start the meditation promptly at 11:30AM, and lunch will be followed right after. The meditation will be conducted while seated in chairs or the floor - your choice. 

If you arrive after 11:30AM, please be considerate to the others and do not enter the meditation area. There is a seating area for you to quietly wait to join us for lunch after the meditation has finished. 

Please let me know in advance if you use medical equipment like a wheel chair or cane so we can ensure access. Guided meditation and lunch will be provided. 

Can't wait to see you all at this exciting event. 

Happy New Year!


This event is sponsored by LUPUS FRIENDS AND FAMILY FOUNDATION (www.LupusFriendsAndFamily.org) and hosted by HAPPY SCIENCE.
results.name: Lupie Meditation Lunch

results.description: Sat. Jan. 16. Brooklyn Botanical Garden. At around 50 acres (only one-fifth the size of the Bronx Garden) the entire garden can be comfortably seen in one visit. Maybe a mile of walking altogether, at a very leisurely pace with many stops. Meet just outside the Eastern Parkway entrance at 11. Take the 2 or 3 subway to the Eastern Parkway station. We'll buy lunch at the Terrace Cafe (reasonable). Admission is free on Saturdays until 12.. In case of inclement weather the garden visit will be converted into a visit to the Brooklyn Museum instead, which is right next door, and has a policy of pay what you wish for admission ($1 is fine). In that case, we'll have lunch in the museum cafeteria. Please email or call me to make sure that the walk is on and/or if you have any questions. Joint with AMC, Urban Trails, and Outdoors Club. No need to RSVP if you are not coming. Bob Susser, [masked];[masked]

results.description:
The Ten Perfections - Loving Kindness


“To reteach a thing its loveliness is the nature of metta. Through lovingkindness, everyone & everything can flower again from within.” ― Sharon <a href="http://www.goodreads.com/author/show/17208.Sharon_Salzberg"></a>Salzberg

This week we will continue our exploration of The Ten Perfections and discuss Loving Kindness.

Loving Kindness practice and the practice of Equanimity we’ll look at next week, support the cultivation of the other perfections. We develop concentration and mindfulness as we focus on the other perfections, but we open our hearts and minds with Loving Kindness practice and are reminded that we are all connected and interdependent.

I once heard Loving Kindness defined as “unstoppable friendliness,” which expresses to me our wish for less suffering and more happiness for others and ourselves. When we hold kindness in our hearts, it also makes it more difficult to feed anger and act from anger.  That is why we can feel more confidence that there is a place of rest and peace available to us.

In formal Loving Kindness practice we offer repeated phrases that express our unstoppable friendliness to a widening circle of beings, but we begin with offering friendliness and kindness to ourselves.  We then wish others well in ever widening circles - of benefactors, close friends, neutral people in our lives, even difficult people in our lives, then to all beings.  The phrases are simple, but living them directly and earnestly in meditation opens our hearts and awakens our minds.

The brief topic discussion will be followed by a guided meditation and time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. I hope you'll join us. 

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.

The Ten Perfections are important mind/body qualities or strengths that we can cultivate in any life situation and on the cushion.  When we make these Perfections our priority in life, they support us on our journey toward awake awareness.      

The Ten Perfections or qualities of mind are:

Generosity (Giving)
Virtue (Morality/Ethics)
Renunciation (Letting go of obstacles to awakening)
Wisdom (Discernment)
Energy (Effort)
Patience (Endurance)
Truthfulness
Determination/Resolution
Loving Kindness/Goodwill
Equanimity (Impartiality and balance)

results.description:
This is a meetup to introduce the Lyndhurst Meditation center and the subtraction meditation method that we study.  It will be an explanation of our method and a dialogue to answer any questions that you may have.  It is not an actual meditation session but we hope to give you a basic understanding of our method.  We welcome anyone who would like to visit our center to come and join us at this meetup.  The Lyndhurst Meditation center is a warm and restful place where everyone is welcome. 

For individuals who can not make this meetup you can feel free to make an appointment for a private introduction for $10.  We offer appointments Monday - Saturday depending upon the meditation schedule of our current members.  Our goal is to keep a comfortable, peaceful and bright environment for our members. 

The Lyndhurst Meditation Center is a non-profit organization that offers guided meditation sessions 7 days a week. We currently have over 30 members who pay monthly membership dues, which are donations used for the maintenance and operational costs of the center.  We offer one month, one year and two year membership plans.  We do not offer memberships on a session by session basis. Our membership fees are non-negotiable and entitle the member to unlimited guided meditation sessions for the duration of the membership.  The $10 cost for the meetup will be applied to any membership plan should an individual decide to become a member of Lyndhurst Meditation.  For more information please visit our website at newjerseymeditation.org

306 Ridge Rd, Lyndhurst, NJ 07071 (201) 933 - 0313

newjerseymeditation.org

Miso is an incredibly healthy paste made form soybeans, sea salt, and koji (a mold starter). I will introduce Shiro-Miso, a white miso with soy beans. I hope you all have wonderful and joy filled holidays.

results.description:
Denim: Fashion's Frontier explores the dynamic history of denim and its relationship with high fashion.  The exhibition traces denim from its origins in work wear of the 19th century, through its role as a symbol of counterculture rebellion in America, to its acceptance into mainstream culture. It culminates with the arrival of blue jeans as luxury items during the late 20th century.


Denim has become one of the world's most beloved fabrics. According to anthropologist Daniel Miller, "On any given day, nearly half the worlds population is in jeans."


Fairy Tale Fashion is a unique and imaginative exhibition that examines fairy tales through the lens of high fashion.  The importance of Cinderella’s glass slippers is widely known, for example, yet these shoes represent only a fraction of the many references to clothing in fairy tales.

Fairy Tale Fashion features more than 80 objects dating from the 18th century to the present, placed within dramatic, fantasy-like settings designed by architect Kim Ackert.

Game description:

We'll play two simultaneous games of 7 on 7.
There will be 4 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!
Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.
No power shots allowed.
If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.
If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.
Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.
Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Sara D. Roosevelt Park, Nike Field
Take the F train to 2nd Avenue Lower East Side, and walk for about 3 minutes on Chrystie Street to the Nike Field between Stanton St & Rivington St
New York, NY 10002
Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.

A positive attitude, pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:


You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for, permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled.
The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Slánte for brunch and a Pint or Two:

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson as he runs the first D&D 5E Module over two parts!

The Sword Coast is siege. In an audacious bid for power, the Cult of the Dragon, along with its dragon allies and the Red Wizards of Thay, seeks to free Tiamat from her prison in the Nine Hells to bring her to the Forgotten Realms. The cult's forces are sweeping from town to town, laying waste to all who oppose them and gathering a hoard of riches for their dread queen. The threat is so dire, factions as disparate as the Harpers and the Zhentarim are banding together to battle the cult. Never before has the need for heroes been as desperate.

This campaign follows the module of the same name, and will be broken into two parts with six sessions each.

results.description:
Let's take an inexpensive tour of the fabulous Grand Lodge of the Freemasons, an ancient fraternal/spiritual organization. One online reviewer described the lodge as "one of the most spectacular buildings I have ever seen!"  After lunch indoors (bring your own or buy it--see details below) we'll walk across town to the Chelsea gallery district, where we'll visit my favorites among the many current exhibitions of high-quality contemporary art.  


PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING DETAILS SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED.

DISTANCE: About 2 miles.

PACE: Moderate, NOT SLOW. If you want to walk slowly, this is not the right event for you.

LUNCH: We'll eat upstairs at a large cafe, with sandwiches and an extensive salad bar. You can bring your own food, but I encourage you to buy at least  something as a courtesy. We'll probably get there no later than 2 PM.

COST: Suggested fee for the tour is $5, but you can pay whatever you wish. Also $2 for me, in part to cover Meetup's organizer fee, plus whatever you pay for lunch.

ENDING TIME: Around 5:30 PM, but you can leave earlier, of course.

TRANSPORTATION: The closest subway stop is the F train at 23rd St. For more details, consult mta.tripplanner.org, Google Transit (maps.google.com/landing/transit/index.html) and/or a subway map, since those sites do not always list the ideal routes. Also check mta.info/weekender for weekend service changes.

WAITING LIST: Sign up and be patient. The list will shrink or disappear by the morning of the walk, due to cancellations and no-shows, especially at the last minute. As a courtesy to others waiting for a spot, please do not sign up unless you intend to go, rather than just as a placeholder in case nothing better turns up. And don't worry about big crowds--the number who actually show up is generally 35 to 55, no matter how many are signed up or waiting.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the lounge at the rear of the lobby. If you arrive early, ask the security person to unlock the lounge for our group. I'll be wearing a red hat.
