results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe. 


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:


2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club Programs or activities.

results.description:
** This class is for anyone who is completely new to improv and have been afraid to try it out. **

** You're welcome to stay and watch the Ensemble class that's happening right after this class ends. **

Public speaking is a powerful skill to have. And there is a powerful way to build upon and enhance your public speaking presence and have a good laugh at the same time: by learning how to improvise!

Improv takes focus, a willingness to embrace the group dynamic and a commitment to fostering your sense of play.

Dewey Chaffee, a professional comedian and improvisor, will lead you through each of these areas with skill, kindness and most importantly, patience, creating an environment that is safe, comfortable, and creatively inspiring.

Improv will make you a better listener, a more open and accepting communicator in life, and a master at slinging bullshit when you need to appear more confident than you feel on the inside!

More details here: www.PlayWithDewey.com

Anyone and everyone is welcome!

Your RSVP and online payment ahead of time is REQUIRED. (This is the only way that we know whether the class will happen or not. RSVP's are also our head count. If you do not RSVP online ahead of time, you are risking showing up to a cancelled event.)

-----------------------------------------------

About Dewey Chaffee

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of TV production.

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show called "The Lady Winifred and Didi Show."
results.name: Basic Improv for Public Speaking

results.description:
I am a therapist, divorce mediator, and adjunct professor at NYU with a specialization in eating disorders. I am interested in helping to facilitate a monthly meet-up group to discuss experiences, treatment options, and helpful ideas in dealing with eating disorders of all types. I have years of experience treating bulimia, binge eating, anorexia, and issues of body image, with excellent results.


In addition to seeing patients individually for eating disorders (among other issues), I'm currently forming an ongoing, weekly therapy group for persons with eating disorders who are looking for something more ongoing and intensive. I work on a sliding fee scale, so I will do what I can to make it work for you. My approach is a combination of psychodynamic, cognitive-behavioral, and Buddhist principles, with a healthy dose of compassion and understanding!

Our meetups are held in Union Square, near 12th Street and University Place.

Please give me a call or email me if you think you might be interested in attending the meet-ups or in learning more about individual or group therapy. Space is somewhat limited, so if you are interested, it's best to call or email me right away.


Thank you!


Judie Stein, Ph.D., L.M.S.W.
Director
Stein Mediation & Family Center


(212)[masked]
[masked]

www.steinmediation.com

results.description:
Happy New Year!   Forget the gym--make a resolution to PLAY MORE GAMES. You can start by filling a January Saturday afternoon with fun games and great people at a comfortable local bar.

Suggested Price of Admission

For $3, the Impact Network can educate a student in Zambia for a month.  With that in mind, I'm going to suggest everyone who comes chip in $3.  What do you get for your money?  Me, my sparkling smile and a pile of games to play with for hours.  And with any luck, they'll be spinning vinyl records.  So come, have a beer, meet good people, listen to some funky music and play great games for a good good cause.  I challenge you to find a better deal for three bucks!

          Four people build a miniature city in Medina

What are we going to play?

It'll be mostly the usual fare of games like Medina,  Nuns on the Run, Avalon, Steam Park, Coup...  These are relatively simple modern board games that have a quick rules explanation and play in less than an hour.

Anything new?

Glad you asked!  I'll have Asteroyds and Whitewater.  Asteryods you have to decide where your space ship needs to go to avoid the asteroids.  Except the asteroids are moving.  And you have a matter of seconds to figure it out!  And Whitewater looks like a ton of fun.  Its a race and you've got two rafts.  But you share them with different people.  Can you you and your partners work together?

What, no Sorry or Pictionary?

This particular meetup focuses on new board games (post-2000) for the most part.  I know a lot of people like the old classics like Trouble, Uno, Monopoly and Taboo but there's some new games that are fun, easy to learn and play in a pretty short time frame.  If you come with an open mind willing to try something new, I think you'll really like the new kids on the block.  I should add, I will flat out refuse to play Cards Against Humanity.  I love edgy, provocative comedy but these guys put into words my feelings on the game better than I could.

If you're really curious about what I might bring, probe the nerdy depths of my collection and visit my Board Game Geek page.  The bar does have a nice copy of Catan on hand as well.

       Whiskey and "Nuns on the Run"--a solid combination

I'm barely getting out of bed when this is starting!

I know that noon on a Saturday is a bit early for people--I get it, believe me--but as long as you show up by 4 (or even 5) you should be able to get some gaming in.

Skylark is a great bar in Park Slope in its own right.  They have been tremendous hosts so have a drink, a little nosh and tip well!  They have some good bar food but are also open to bringing food as long as we clean up.

       A couple of tables happily gaming the day away

My phone number is listed near the top of this posting if you have any questions day-of.  And with that we'll see you there!  Or else...

Point guns at each other in Ca$h 'n Gun$

(This picture refuses to stay rotated.  Still kinda works though)

results.description:
At “Monozukuri Saturday”, we invite guest speakers and ask them to speak of making things, followed by events regarding "making things", such as make-a-thons and workshops.

Our second Monozukuri Saturday meetup in 2016 features Saki Hayashi, a recent graduate from ITP at NYU who is awarded Union Foundation for Ergo Design Grant 2014 and Future of Storytelling Grant.

[Monozukuri Saturday for makers] Meet Saki Hayashi & be a maker! Why you should learn Rhinoceros?


For a make-a-thon, "Smart Architectural Blocks", one of her work at ITP, is great. But this work is still displayed at the Brooklyn Navy Yard, so we should wait until this is returned.

She plans to have a workshop on Rhinoceros 3D, a commercial 3D computer graphics and computer-aided design (CAD) application.


Agenda of the day


• Place: The Coffee Foundry, 186 W 4th St, New York, NY 10014

• Date: Saturday, January 16th, 2016

• Time Schedule:

• 12:00noon - 1:00pm Conversation & Networking


• 1:00pm - 4:00pm Workshop on Rhinoceros

Please register in advance for the workshop if you are sure to attend, as we need to reserve an appropriate room.

Register for [Monozukuri Saturday Workshop] Rhinoceros 3D Software

results.description:
Lesser Known Manhattan:  Morningside Heights & Manhattanville

There is perhaps no other neighborhood in NYC nor America like Morningside Heights, our city's intellectual and spiritual capital which has been called the "American Acropolis."  The area is home to seven colleges and universities including Columbia University, the Manhattan School of Music, Barnard College and two renowned seminaries.  Graduates and faculty members have had a huge impact on the world and we'll learn about these special people during our stroll. Towering over the neighborhood is the magnificent bell tower of Riverside Church and if you have never visited the Cathedral of St. John the Divine you will be blown away!

St. John the Divine is the world's largest Gothic Cathedral and is much more than a house of worship -- with year round concerts, festivals and art exhibits. Our walk will include the history of this fascinating area along with some of the hidden gems like Sakura Park, Grotto Church of Notre Dame, Morningside Drive and Park, and Grant's Tomb National Monument -- once the city's most popular tourist attraction!

We will stroll through Manhattanville at the end of tour, an off-the grid Harlem neighborhood with own unique character and history as an industrial area and village that was established in the year 1806 -- and now where Columbia University is building its new 17 acre campus.  We'll uncover the origin of some of its streets like Old Broadway and Tiemann Place.  

Optional lunch - heart Cuban fare at Floridita after the walk!  We will finish at a convenient location near 125th Street and Broadway.

http://harlemsfloridita.com/


Best regards,

Hank

[masked]

[masked]

results.description:
Join us on Saturday, January 16th from 12 PM to 4 PM for It’s Your Turn to Receive: Self-Care Made Easy for Women Entrepreneurs with Tracy Robin of Holistic Women Entrepreneurs of NJ & NYC and Sam Popp of Teach + Learn Networking.

Get tickets here.

Stress is inevitable, self-care is a choice.

Between running a business, meeting with clients, social life, family and kids, there never seems to be enough time or money or energy left over for you to take care of you. Over-working, under-earning, getting depleted, rundown & burnt out because you are trying to DO IT ALL so you can HAVE IT ALL has become an epidemic for Female Entrepreneurs.

But did you know that being a successful woman in business REQUIRES you to put your emotional, physical, and spiritual well-beings first?

Your ability to relax and recharge is directly related to your bottom line, health, relationships, and especially, your ability to attract your ideal clients & be able to charge your worth. So, how do you escape the feeling of overwhelm and being too busy to do anything about it?

Creating a realistic self-care plan that’s easy to stick to is the answer.

Join Tracy and Sam for a special 4-hour event where it’s your turn to receive. After an afternoon of learning, sharing, and most of all relaxing, you’ll leave feeling empowered to make yourself a priority, in life and business, no matter what.

Get tickets here.


WHO THIS EVENT IS FOR?

• Female professionals, entrepreneurs, creatives, and business owners that are ready to change their relationship to stress.

WHAT YOU’LL GET

• An afternoon of mini-workshops on restorative yoga, meditation, journaling, positive communication, aromatherapy, and more

• A new toolbox to create a realistic self-care plan to tackle stress head-on

• Networking and sisterhood with other lady entrepreneurs

• Healthy light bites from our sponsors

WHAT TO BRING:

• Dress comfortably in clothes you can move in easily

• Bring a small wash cloth, a hand towl, and a beach towel to use as props

• Bring a notebook or journal and a pen 

 LIMITED SPACE AVAILABLE!

* Doors open at 11:45 am, event starts at 12:00 pm sharp *

Get tickets here.

WHO ARE THE INSTRUCTORS?

Tracy Robin @tracyrobinwr

Tracy Robin is a Certified Life Coach & Business Mentor for entrepreneurs, an ERYT500, a Certified Kripalu Yoga Teacher, the co-owner & founder of Shine Yoga Center in Cliffside Park, New Jersey and the director of Shine Yoga Center’s Yoga Teacher Certification Program. Tracy left a corporate gig in the entertainment industry after struggling with the physical, mental & emotional toll the stress level took on her life. Then she became an entrepreneur! This brought with it a whole new breed of stress. Tracy is thrilled to share user-friendly practices to help reduce stress & anxiety and guide you to a place of greater joy & self-awareness. She coaches clients globally and travels nationally & internationally leading classes, workshops & retreats.

Sam Popp @sampoppnyc

Sam Popp is the founder and owner of Teach and Learn Networking, where produces events and a newsletter for entrepreneurs. Drawing on her past experience weathering the ups and downs of a social worker career, Sam is excited to share how easy and essential self-care should be. Sam is Jersey born and raised, but now lives in Manhattan. 

SPACE PARTNER - Shine Yoga Center @shineyoganj

Shine Yoga Center is a modern yoga studio and event space in Cliffside Park, NJ, only 10 mins from NYC via the GWB. Interested in our classes or hosting your next event at Shine? Learn more at http://www.shineyogacenter.com/main

Refund Policy: There are no refunds for this event. Please see our refund policy here. All sales are final & no refunds will be provided for any reason. If a meet-up is cancelled or rescheduled, we will, however, credit your payment toward the next meet-up. You can read our full refund policy here: http://www.tracyrobin.com/return-policy/ 

OUR SPONSORS

Get tickets here.
results.name: WORKSHOP: It's Your Turn to Receive: Self-Care Made Easy for Women Entrepreneurs

results.description:

results.description:
Waiting List: The day before an event we tend to have a lot of people drop out so do not be discouraged if you're on the waiting list--there's a good chance you'll be able to join.


Attending List: Please remember that the RSVP list closes at 5pm the day before an event. If you change your RSVP to NO after that time or are a no-show, someone on the waiting list could be left out. We take that very seriously.

Club Hours: C&B sets aside space for us from 12:30pm to 2:30pm so those are the official club hours. Everyone is free to stay longer if they wish.

First-Timers: If it is your first time at C&B, you will have to take a lesson from the range staff. If you are an experienced archer, you must at least stay for the safety portion (no exceptions, range rules). Lessons start at half past the hour so if you miss the 12:30pm, you may have to sit around and wait for the 1:30pm. Please be on time.

Public Transportation: LIRR to Hicksville and then a taxi from the station to C&B (make sure to tell them 11 Commercial St in Hicksville). The train from Penn gets into Hicksville at 11:55 am. The one-way cab rate as of 1/1/16 is roughly $6.30 (http://www.worldtaximeter.com/new-york/hicksville+train+station/440+jericho+turnpike%2C+hicksville) +$2 for each additional person. Those of you taking the train may wish to post a message to the group to share a cab.

Range Costs: Make sure to mention when you pay for range time you are shooting with the NYC Archery Group to get the CLUB ONLY rates:

$7.00 for the first hour, $5 each additional hour OR $15 to shoot all day
$1.00 for a target
$11 per hour for a rental bow and arrows
$5.00 for a lesson (includes first hour)

Visit the C&B website for the most up-to-date information.

See you on the shooting line!

results.description:
Many members have been asking for our Saturday Figure Drawing Session.

Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of The Flatiron District.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.) 

• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.   

• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels.  

• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

Our amazing space!

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
Meeting Details sent out 6:15 P.M. Friday by e-mail to all those who RSVP'd. If you do not receive, contact me immediately, don't post a comment, and provide me with your personal e-mail and I will resend.                                        

RSVP'S ARE CLOSED

PLEASE READ THIS CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU RSVP. I TAKE THE RSVP PROCESS VERY SERIOUSLY AND I EXPECT THAT YOU SHOULD TOO.

MEETING DETAILS WILL BE SENT OUT FRIDAY JANUARY 15, 2016 IN THE EVENING.

Join me and AMC club members who do not have to RSVP, UNLESS you do not get last minute e-mails-this one will be posted very soon- on a fun fast paced 5-6 mile safari like event (Don’t ask me how I figured out the mileage) which I am doing for the first time and which will include visits to and thru numerous neighborhoods. The one common theme and focus is that we will be visiting select art galleries throughout this adventure. Other than visiting the galleries, we will not stop much when we are outside. This will be more grueling than you think!

We will meet BEFORE 1:00 P.M. Be ready to go. WE LEAVE ON TIME. NO FOOD STOPS.

This will be fast paced, interesting and a fun whirlwind of an event. There may be some freestyling involved-ask me what that is when you see me. We’ll start out visiting several select galleries in the Lower East Side very briefly because of their special photography exhibits and then we’ll move on to Soho to visit a couple more select galleries-also very briefly. The key word is briefly. And then we’ll go thru the Village to get to Chelsea. This time we WON’T be visiting the normal 20-25 art galleries in Chelsea in a few hours that we’ve done in the past with the Club-which is somewhat insane but a lot of fun- but we’ll concentrate on only several of the galleries I like best or I think have the best exhibits in Chelsea. In addition, there are a few architectural wonders and places of historic interest we will see as well throughout our journey. There will be plenty of surprises along the way. I plan on hopefully finishing up somewhere near 27th Street on the West Side and there may be an optional visit to the new Hudson Yards Subway Station at 34th Street where we can talk very very briefly about the design of the station-unless you just can’t take it any more. (We visited the new subway station recently but the only reason I plan on going there this time is because that’s the station I will use to get home if the #7 is running!). 

 Please consider joining the Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC) http://www.amc-ny.org/ The Club offers many hikes, walks and events and is also active in conservation efforts and trail maintenance. Only a few of the many hikes and walks that are offered by AMC leaders are posted on Meetup.

Since this event will be posted as a last minute hike to AMC Club members, there is NO need for AMC Club members to RSVP for this-UNLESS –you don’t get last minute e-mails (Contact me –don’t post a comment-if you are a dues paying member a few days before the hike and I’ll tell you how to get these e-mails). Let’s leave 10 spaces for AMC Meetup members. (I am going to give preference to those who have attended hikes I have led in the past.). 

Needless to say, please take the RSVP process seriously and be considerate. If you have been a NO SHOW on any of the previous AMC Meetup events that I have led or you abuse the RSVP process-see your Attendance History- please do not sign up for this event. Unfortunately your ship has sailed. 

I am going to ask that people not post any comments or questions prior to the event. You have more than enough information to do this once you get the meeting details. No offense, but I don’t need to know-and probably neither does anyone else- what you are doing that day if you can’t make it or what you think the weather will be. AFTER the event, post as many comments and photos as you like.

If the weather forecast is really bad, See Accuweather like I do, I will post a notice Saturday morning by 10:00 A.M. (If it’s really really cold, we can spend a little more time in the galleries and shorten the hike.) If there is no notice, we go. We will finish before 5:30 P.M.
results.name: Lower  East Side/Soho/The Village/ Chelsea Expedition including a  Gallery Hop.

results.description:
One very important lesson is often get missed in art classes: do you know which one? That is the skill of producing successful two dimensional design by learning the basics of drawing from life and elements of design. 


At this workshop, produce at least one piece of finished work and several quick sketches. Learn the skill that is based on the method that master artists through the art history.
Sign up to practice the first and the most important step to achieve successful Drawing and Design!

Workshop Fee: $20.00 - socialize, sip some wine, make your own artwork.

This workshop is part of our big art event, "Show Your World", with the Opening on January 15, 6 PM, at Gallery MC.

Instructor: exhibiting artist and educator, Hadieh Afshani. Finalist of the "Show Your World" International Art Competition.

Hadieh Afshani is an active fine artist who did her undergraduate study in Fine Arts (Painting) in her hometown, Tehran, and finished her M.A in Queensland College of Arts - Griffith University in Brisbane, Australia. 

In 2009, Hadieh began working as a lecturer and tutor in QCA teaching Life Drawing, Drawing and Visual Arts and Designs courses for Fine Art, Graphic Design and Animation departments. She has also been an art instructor for different private galleries and art institutes around Australia.

Hadieh Afshani has been a finalist and a winner of numerous national and international art awards and competitions inside and outside of Australia. Recently she is working and exhibiting her works in the United States of America.

Hadieh is a representational artist. She practiced and learned the knowledge of old masters by going to different artists art studio and attending different classes and workshops around the world. 


Grab with you for the workshop - Material List:

• A3 or A4 sketchbook (A3 is preferred or even bigger if you can hold it while you sitting)

• 12 inches ruler

• Willow or vine charcoal (thin and thick/extra thick) and/or 4B pencil and a piece of Graphite.

• Tissue paper or paper towel 

• Eraser

*The artwork is by Hadieh Afshani. The cover image: a student's work.

results.description:
Our next meetup will focus on: Hypocrisy.

The meetup runs as follows:


1) The moderator selects one subject for discussion and a date for the meeting. Subjects can be as ephemeral as "love," "god," and "purpose," or as grounded as "politics," "environmentalism," and "family."

2) At the meetup, people are encouraged to propose a question related to the subject. The moderator will collect all of the questions in a list. Questions may also be proposed ahead of time online on the event page.

3) The group will then vote on the questions. In the first round of voting, each individual may vote for as many questions as they like. The top three will then go to a second round, where each individual may vote just once.

4) The question with the most votes is then discussed. Often, the discussion starts with a narrowing of the question, as it can be challenging to devise a question that can possibly be answered by a small group in just a couple of hours' discussion.

Finally, please consider making a small donation to help the moderator cover subscription costs.
results.name: Let's Talk About: Hypocrisy

It is important for us as students of spirituality and mysticism to become aware and acquainted with the tremendous resources that are available to us to make our lives more harmonious.

Once we learn to tap these inner resources, living will be an invigorating affair continuing and picking up where we left off in previous life experiences and thereby advancing and expanding the consciousness.

We need to keep foremost in our consciousness certain principles, conditions and laws to gain access to spiritual tools and to arrive at permanent solutions to life's challenges.

Through lectures, participation in meditation, and visualization exercises, we will be given the opportunity to experience the value of discussing these principles in a group setting.

results.description:
As Empaths, we have an innate ability to care for others. Yet, sometimes we find ourselves in an emotional rut with no idea how to get out or move forward. But, we can change... we can grow... we can be inspired... we can inspire others.

Sometimes, to get to the next level, we just need to listen... Listen to someone share their own story... Describe their personal struggles... Reflect on how they arrived to where they are now... Explain where they want to be in life and what they are doing to get there.

Sometimes, to get to the next level, we just need to talk... Talk about the mistakes of our past... About our experiences... About what we want for ourselves... About the things we are grateful for... About the hope we have.

We'd like you to join us on Saturday, January 16th, at 1:00PM for an afternoon of inspiration. You will be inspired this day... and maybe you will help inspire others. We will have a guest speaker, Corey Hudson, who is a Photojournalist from CT. he is the author of an amazing book, "Every Heart Has a Story to Tell".

Corey travels the country, inspiring complete strangers to share their stories of personal hardships they've faced as well as the things for which they are grateful. These stories have become part of Corey's book as well as his blog called, "Hearts of Strangers".

This event will be filmed as part of a documentary. Corey will be accepting any volunteers who wish to share their own personal stories. But participation is not required.

We will announce the location within the next few weeks. Corey will be accepting donations to help fund his project. Contributions are not required, but we do encourage it... even $5 or $10 would help.

We look forward to seeing you then.

Cheers!

Raquel H.
results.name: Get Inspired! Be an Inspiration!

results.description:
** Saturday Afternoon Open Play/Clinic Combos**

We now offer, Beginner, Intermediate and occasionally Advanced, Saturday afternoon Combined Open Play/Clinics for the UNBELIEVABLE PRICE of $14.00 for a 3 hr. Session!

An Open Play/Clinic! What’s that?........It is our unique creation! Three hours of Open Play and Clinic combined! Here’s how it works. 3 teams of 8 players each alternate playing games on one of our 2 main courts at Brandeis H.S. (84th st. bet Columbus & Amsterdam) Now get this, while the third team is out, instead of sitting around, that team gets a clinic (8 players to one coach) on our back court at Brandeis with a top instructor. When the two teams finish their game on the main court, one comes off for instruction. Meanwhile, the players that just received instruction take what they just learned and use it in the next game. This rotation continues for 3 hrs! It is a great way to meet new players and improve your skills at the same time.  It is an absolutely unbelievable deal!

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space.

http://nyurban.com/open-play-registration-vb/?filter_id=1&gametypeid=1

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.

Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

results.description:
Hi Ladies,

Happy New Year ! Let's make this one an extraordinary one:).

We did this meetup last year and it was a hit. The Venue is a beautiful, upscale, well maintained, and trendy, place to bowl, play pool, or arcade games, or sit in the lounge and have a drink.


You can enter on 9th ave or the entrance inside Port Authority..

You can click the link for more info here: http://www.framesnyc.com

The idea is that everyone gets to bowl at least 2 games so we don't want to have too many women on each lane.

Here is how the pricing goes:  They charge $60 per lane per hour and $7 per pair of bowling shoes.


 If we rent the lanes for 2  for 3 hours, it will take forever to get up to bowl your turn, so I am thinking of renting 3 lanes, for 2 hours.

I have to put the entire rental on my credit card before we arrive, order to reserve the lanes for us. I did this last year and  22 women rsvpd and 13 showed up. It was a bit confusing.

The cost to you will be determined by how many women show up..

Figure around $15 to bowl plus $7 for shoes approximately.


I will reserve only 2 lanes to start, as the number of RSVP's increase, I can always ADD a lane,  But I cannot subtract once I reserve .

So, I'm asking in all earnest, PLEASE RSVP ONLY IF YOU ARE 98 PERCENT CERTAIN YOU WILL  MAKE IT.

Since I am putting money down up front, it is critical that I don't end up paying out of my pocket.

This is a fun, and lively way to talk, and to meet new people.

Let's have fun, if you are a beginner, or you are a pro, join us for a fun afternoon.

If you want to arrive early  and utilize the arcade, or the billiard tables, I would do that before 2, or if you just want to come and play pool, make sure you have a partner to do so with.

Food and drinks are extra. A few of us may go to grab a bite afterwards but no reservations are being made, we can play it by ear. Last year the group went to Tavola Restaurant on 10th ave. We can go there or to another place.

Lets meet, have fun, and start the new year and be social,

I look forward to seeing at least 20 of you on Saturday.

Hugs,

xxx

Carly

results.description:
Greek cuisine... Most people automatically defer to gyros, feta cheese and yogurt. Authentic Greek cuisine consists of fresh flavor filled food combined with lots of grandiose seafood creations including octopus, swordfish and local varieties of branzino and grilled shrimp.

Dishes take on dinosauresque monikers like Kolokithokeftedes (Zucchini Croquettes) and Tyrokafteri. (Spicy Feta) odd to pronounce words promising flavor for the bold. My good man Franklin, (The Foolinary of the clique) has never had the pleasure of indulging in any of the aforementioned. Greek for him is getting a gyro (pronounced yee-ro by the way) made of a mash-up of meats from parts unknown from some odds and ends pizza shop serving hot wings. Add some fries and ketchup to that you that's a Greek meal for my dude.


We are going to change all of this. Join us as we explore authentic Greek cuisine at Souvlaki GR on the lower east side. Souvlaki GR started out as a food truck roaming the streets of NYC before the NYC underbelly greed set in shutting down many of the food trucks roaming the city.  Souvlaki GR was able to get up enough dough to setup a brick and mortar serving up their famous Souvlaki and expanding their menu to add more family classics from Mykonos. Watch the hijinks as Frank takes his first bite of Greek authenticity. (aka Lamb shit) It will be fabulous.


Remember: These events are highly interactive. We will be taking video and pictures to supplement for the Culinary Foolinary podcast. We would love your involvement in this process to round out our mission. In advance, Stin ighia' soo! (Cheers) See you there!


Follow Us!:
CulinaryFoolinary.com
Facebook
Twitter
Instagram

****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 15 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Basic Ground Rules for Participation

Please wear either a blue/black or white shirt to make things easy (Preferably bring both in case we need to mix the teams more evenly).


no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc. If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF. If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...). If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.

What is Ultimate Frisbee? In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee. You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.

results.description:
About Seth Godin:

SETH GODIN is the author of 18 books that have been bestsellers around the world and have been translated into more than 35 languages. He writes about the post-industrial revolution, the way ideas spread, marketing, quitting, leadership and most of all, changing everything. You might be familiar with his books Linchpin, Tribes, The Dip and Purple Cow.

In addition to his writing and speaking, Seth founded both Yoyodyne and Squidoo. His blog (which you can find by typing "seth" into Google) is one of the most popular in the world.

He was recently inducted into the Direct Marketing Hall of Fame, one of three chosen for this honor in 2013.

Recently, Godin once again set the book publishing industry on its ear by launching a series of four books via Kickstarter. The campaign reached its goal after three hours and ended up becoming the most successful book project ever done this way.

His newest book, What To Do When It's Your Turn, is already a bestseller.

To Secure Your Spot Register Here

About the Event: 

By: Seth Godin & Do You Zoom, Inc.

This is a new way to learn, designed for people who seek to make a difference.

A live online course that students do together, guided by pre-recorded video... using real-time writing and interaction to create change and connection.

A three-hour intensive workshop, with all participants in sync. Start together, finish together, interact.

Like the altMBA, we run this workshop in a private, customized Slack room. But this workshop lasts just three hours, and it's a sprint.

Some learning doesn’t easily come from a mere lecture. It comes from engagement. Engagement with others, fellow students, people on the same path as you. And even more important, from self awareness, from writing and speaking about what matters, what you see and what you are capable of.

This intensive workshop is designed to explore what it means to be a leader, and more important, what it means for you to be a leader.

It's designed for anyone who has ever sought to make a difference. For entrepreneurs, middle managers, parents and everyone who has ever needed to stand up and say, "follow me."

There is just over thirty minutes of original video, but far more important are the 120 minutes you will spend on doing the work, writing and connecting. Connecting not only with the video, but with the other students in the course.

Most online courses are done solo, on your own time. This three-hour workshop is different.

Here's how it works: 

As the workshop unfolds, there are nine sections on various facets of leadership.

First, each section starts off with a video which I've recorded specifically for this course, dropped into the Slack room.

Next, there is an exercise or discussion prompt for you to work on with your group in Slack. You'll answer the question and work on your own writing.

Finally, you'll come together with other participants in Slack to engage on what you've learned via live chat.

The sections:

- Leadership is not management

- See the end before you begin the journey

- Culture defeats everything

- Selling the dream

- Enrollment

- Don’t forget rule 6

- Authority vs. responsibility

- Certain failure

- It’s personal

After the session is over, you will have a written record of the transformation you’ve caused in yourself and in others.

100% of our revenue is going to Acumen to help them create more courses for social entrepreneurs and those hoping to make an impact.

We're looking forward to engaging with you.

PLEASE NOTE! You will get a further instructions on the confirmation page after purchasing a ticket. You'll also get an invite to the Slack room, from Slack, the morning of the event. Please check your spam folder... you'll need the link to access the course.

WHEN

Saturday, January 16, 2016 from 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM (EST) 

WHERE

Online, in a private Slack room

To Secure Your Spot Register Here

results.description:
This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!
results.name: Saturday Python Study Group

results.description:
Location: 11th floor, Deerbrook conference room

The purpose of the event is to provide a common space to work on, help, and be helped by fellow coders on any topic or technology that is Javascript related. It will take place concurrently with the Saturday NYC Python Study Group in an adjacent area, and there will be ample opportunity for cross pollination between the two groups. **Note that ID is required at the door when checking in for the event with security**

More info about the Python study group: 
http://www.meetup.com/learn-python-nyc/events/mksjflytfblc
results.how_to_find_us: Sign in with security with a photo ID and take the elevator to the 11th floor. Walk through the large bronze door to the Deerbrook conference room.
results.name: Study Group: Work on individual projects and help each other code

results.description:
Let's meet at a new location at Manhattan's Bowery Whole Foods at 95 East Houston St., between Bowery and Chrystie. There's a spacious eat in area on the second floor. Please purchase fruit or salad from Whole Foods so we will be welcome there in the future. Since raw fruit and salad is the basis of the 80/10/10 diet, let's support each other by having food together that falls within 80/10/10 guidelines. 80/10/10 beverages include water, coconut water and some occasionally have juices.

I will post my cell phone number in the comments the day before the event so you can contact me if you have trouble finding us or want to know if we are still there. :)

This location is a mile walk from 230 Grand Street which often sells durian.  While I don't recommend bringing the durian into Whole Foods as the smell might bother others, you can consider stopping there to get some before or after the meetup.  This particular location cuts it up for you.  I'm not positive they will be open that particular day but they are usually there on Saturdays.  They are Durian NYC on Facebook if you want to look them up.
results.how_to_find_us: If taking subway, Bleeker St and Broadway/Lafayette subway stops are the closest.  I will post my phone number in the comments the day before the meetup so if you have trouble finding us once there you can call me.

results.description:
This is my second year attending this valuable program. Under Lee Reiser, ACA level ll instructor, will help you hone your existing skills, learn new ones properly and introduce new people to the world of kayaking. In a beautiful heated pool with all kayaks and gear provided you can train for 2 hours learning bracing, rolling, rescues etc. and in return help the public for 2 hours by setting up and putting equipment away, greeting the public students, assisting instructors etc. All level of kayakers are welcome. The sessions are as follows:
Course 1 Saturday - Nov. 14,21; Dec. 5, 12
Course 2 " - Jan. 9, 16, 23, 30
Course 3 " - Feb. 6, 13, 27; March 5
The time for volunteers to practice is from 3 to 4 pm and the time to volunteer is from 4 to 6 pm. Please arrive at least 15 minutes before so you can get ready. Pack a small bag with your change of clothes. The pool is heated but you may want to wear a wet suit, bringing your own PFD, paddle and skirt can add to your comfort level. Pack a small bag with a change of clothes, towel etc and bring a lock for the lockers.
Please fill out the volunteer packet which can be obtained from the Yonkers Club site: http://www.yprc.org
click on the Riverbank link once you are in the site and download the NY community Kayak Program packet. If you commit to at least 1 session you will be provided with a parking pass.

DIRECTIONS- From 138th St. head west and make a left onto 12th Ave., Take the 1st right beneath the West Side Hwy (by the restaurant) then swing right again past the first guard booth. Follow the roadway in and around, curve left and make a hard left U-turn into the parking area. Use the elevator to get to the park on the upper level walk to the pool area. Make sure you have a parking permit in your car window. Please car pool as parking is limited.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION CAN BE FOUND ON THE NOV. 21, 2015 POSTING FOR THIS ONGOING OUTING.
results.name: Volunteer, learn new skills and kayak at the NY Community Kayak Program.

results.description:
Under Lee Reiser, ACA level ll instructor, will help you hone your existing skills, learn new ones properly and introduce new people to the world of kayaking. In a beautiful heated pool with all kayaks and gear provided you can train for 2 hours learning bracing, rolling, rescues etc. and in return help the public for 2 hours by setting up and putting equipment away, greeting the public students, assisting instructors etc. All level of kayakers are welcome.

The sessions are as follows:
Course 1 Saturday - Nov. 14, 21; Dec. 5, 12, 2015
Course 2 " - Jan. 9, 16, 23, 30, 2016
Course 3 " - Feb. 6, 13, 27; March 5, 2016

Spots are limited to 8 HVH members per session !


  The time for volunteers to practice is from 3 to 4 pm, and the time to volunteer is from 4 to 6 pm. Please arrive at least 15 minutes before so you can get ready. Pack a small bag with your change of clothes. The pool is heated but you may want to wear a wet suit, bringing your own PFD, paddle and skirt can add to your comfort level. Nose, ear plugs and goggles are helpful for rolling practice.  Pack a small bag with a change of clothes, towel etc. and bring a lock for the lockers.


Please fill out the volunteer packet which can be obtained from the Yonkers Club site: http://www.yprc.org
click on the Riverbank link once you are in the site and download the NY community Kayak Program packet. If you commit to at least 1 session you will be provided with a parking pass. If you are attending contact Audrey Jackson, Program Coordinator at:  [masked]


Parking & Direction


- From Broadway, take West 145 street all the way to the Guard at the booth of 145 street & RiverSide drive.

- Let the Guard knows that you need to get the parking permit and instruction to get to the pool and he will give you a parking slip with all instruction where to park and how to get to the pool.

- After, you will need to go back to Broadway and make right then another right on West 138 Street. Take it all the way to the end. After the stop sign go under the bridge and make your first right.

- You will go through another Guard Booth and stay to your right and follow the curve and you will see the parking lot on your left.

- Take the elevator to the top and stay on your right to find the pool


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review maps and water features carefully; understanding conditions of any trip is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. Capsizing is always a possibility when engaged in a paddling trip, be mentally prepared and know how to swim and self-rescue before going on any paddling trip.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a paddling trip (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike/paddle signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: Volunteer & Indoor Winter Kayak Series Part 2@ the NY Community Kayak Program

results.description:
Well if there is one great thing about this meetup, it is, we are all foodies. There is always an opportunity to meet with someone and discover somewhere great and new to eat in the City. A member and I wondered onto this little gem while starving after volunteering at GLWD. Let me say, it was awesome. They made the simplest Burger seem like a night at Mardi Gras. Join me and 9 others as we enjoy a day of dining at the famous Baker & Co.


We meet at 2:45 p.m. and sit to eat promptly at 3:00 p.m,

Group Dining Rules 

This is not a family style restaurant. There is only one bill. You only pay your meal or drink and (tax & tip) 20% plus 8.875% =[masked]%. Please bring cash, this restaurant will not take multiple credit cards for one bill. Please be on time, weekend travel is always difficult. 

This always works because we only pay the bill 40 minutes after we've held the menu, so wee know how much we've spent. 


Please pay attention: We will be contacting all members 72 hours before the event. An email will be sent out requesting confirmation, those who fail to reply by the date requested, will be replaced by a member on the waiting list Hey Olisa, join the conversation!
results.name: The Intimate "Baker & Co" | West Village

results.description:
This is a 2-part event. Please join us for either one or both - whatever you want, no obligation! 

Leafletting sounds scary? Just come for dinner!

Hate food? Just come for leafletting!

I'm planning on making this a weekly event, where people can feel free to join for part or all, whenever they can, and hopefully with time it will grow into a fun weekly outreach & social event that people look forward to all week!

This week I am changing the time due to the Bull Riding Protest taking place at Madison Square Garden at 5:30.

3-4: Leafleting (Penn Station)

4-5:30: Dinner (Cinnamon Snail)

Next week and beyond: 

5-6pm: Leafleting in subway station

6-9pm: Dinner at an awesome vegan restaurant

One hour is not much for leafleting, so try to be on time or early! Me and/or my leafleting partner Jim will probably be there early if you want to leaflet longer than an hour.

Please invite anyone and everyone! 

Facebook event: https://www.facebook.com/events/515342948672457/

The plan is that each week will be held at a different restaurant and we will leaflet for 1 hour at a subway close to the restaurant. Feel free to comment with your restaurant suggestions. Here are some ideas to get us started:

Cinnamon Snail - 1/16

Avant Garden

Marty's Vburger

Seasoned Vegan

By Chloe

Caravan of Dreams

Beyond Sushi

VSpot Organic

VSpot NYCC

VBurger

Blossom Du Jour

Quintessence

Candle

Toad Style

results.description:
The League of Legends Championship Series (LCS) is the preeminent League of Legends esports league in North America and Europe. Each LCS league (NA and EU) is comprised of 10 teams facing every other team twice over the course of the season, for a total of 18 games each. Matches are played in a Best of 1 format, with each team playing once per day. The competition stretches across two splits, Spring and Summer.
___________________________

We're back! Welcome to Season 6 of the NA League of Legends Championship series! Come enjoy the action with us at Playwright Pub! The top floor will be open to everyone (since it's also serves delicious food), so bring your friends! Just make sure that if you're underaged, you do not drink. It's illegal.

SCHEDULE (times are approximate):

3PM: TSM v CLG
4PM: C9 v IMT
5PM: DIG v NRG
6PM: REN v TL
7PM: FOX v TIP

We've got bar specials! All Well Mixers and select domestic draft beers are $5!

Don't follow esports? No problem, tons of us will be around to get you acquainted with the teams! New to League? Welcome to the party! We all love the game and love new friends!

Looking for people to play fantasy with? We love to theorycraft and welcome your bold predictions!

Join us on the first day of the NA season for good food, good friends, and good games!

With love, League of Libations. ♥
results.name: League of Libations NALCS S6 W1D1 Party! (ALL AGES)

results.description:
Everybody with a smartphone is a photographer now. But not everybody is a GOOD photographer. What do you need to be really, really good at depicting or creating your own reality with a camera?

At this workshop get backstage at the photo and video art production. Meet our special guests - the artists Kirill Ovchinnikov and Evgenia Killikh - and learn how to use a field camera, how to take pictures and make a footage in a best way. Watch the examples of the video art created by Kirill Ovchinnikov and Evgenia Killikh, the instructors of this workshop. Socialize, sip some wine with us.

The workshop fee: $20.00 (covers the class, wine, beverages).

This event is part of the "Show Your World" exhibition - create your own world with the help of a camera and Professionals!

About the Instructors: Kirill Ovchinnikov is a renowned art photographer, finalist of the international art competition, "Show Your World". He has been shooting for "Elle", "Interior+Design", "Esquire", "Vogue", "Forbes", and many other popular covers. Besides, Kirill Ovchinnikov is working on his art projects, photo and video, - his works have been shown at numerous exhibits and in museums.

Evgenia Killikh is a documentary film director, journalist, having worked for the Cosmopolitan and other glossy magazines, hosted her own TV-show about Fashion and Style. Recently, Evgenia presented her own documentary, "Agar-Agar. Grass from the Ocean" at the Amsterdam Film Festival.
results.how_to_find_us: Gallery MC is located on the 8th Floor.
results.name: Depict the Reality or Create a New One: Art Photography & Video Art
Let's meet for tempura and sushi again!

results.description:
Our monthly meetup to discuss two articles. If you would like to suggest an article, please do so in the comments below. RSVPs will open two weeks before day of meetup.  Priority on the waitlist will be given to individuals who have previously contributed to good discussion, posted a thoughtful comment or suggested an article.


This month's topic is science. We'll discuss what makes science, science, how science is like any social activity, susceptible to popularity and what makes it different. 

Topic 1: 

Spooked: What do we learn about science from a controversy in physics?

Topic 2: 

Inflamed The debate over the latest cure-all craze.

Pre-meeting topic: 

There’s a good reason Americans are horrible at science


updates from previous discussions: 

Anxiety Aside, New York Sees Drop in Crime in 2015
results.name: January Meetup: Science

results.description:
Prepay here:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=UAC58MMY79XFL

=============================================

On this tour of Tribeca, in addition to visiting the art galleries, we will also be exploring the "applied arts" as we check out the showrooms of the Design District. There we will see everyday things, such as furniture, lighting, clothing or electronics, ingeniously created to be works of art while still retaining their functionality.

The tour will be led by Savona Bailey-McClain, founder and executive director of the West Harlem Art Fund, an organization that promotes art and culture in parks and other open spaces across NYC, as well as galleries. She has been involved in numerous public art installations and was recently selected to join TINA, a new international network for contemporary art curators based in Italy. In addition, she hosts "State of the Arts NYC", a weekly radio program airing Fridays on WBAI, 99.5 FM.

IMPORTANT: 

- Prepay here:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=UAC58MMY79XFL

- If you tried to use the above link but had trouble with Paypal, an alternate payment link on Brown Paper Tickets will be emailed upon request. This will require an extra $1 charge to help cover the higher fees with this processor. 

- On January 15 (one day before), the price will go up to $25 if the event has not sold out.  Purchasing your spot as early as possible is recommended.

- RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your spot or lock in the price.

- Online payment deadline is 10:30am on the day of the tour.

- If space is available, payment can be made on-site ($25, cash only).

- Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled).  However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place.  At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.

- Take the A/C/E line to Canal Street, but exit the station at Walker Street. Meeting point is just past (north of) the subway entrance on 6th Avenue.

- If you are late or having trouble finding the group, call or text (917) 680-0656.  This is not a smartphone, so posting comments or sending messages through the Meetup site will NOT work.

- Please remember to bring photo ID in case it is requested by security at some of the galleries.

- Feel free to bring your camera.  Taking pictures is allowed.

- The tour will last one and a half to two hours.  Afterward, we will go somewhere nearby for food and socializing if there is interest.

- Gratuities are welcomed. 

- Art novices are welcome, as are people with extensive art backgrounds.

- This event is exclusively for members of my meetup groups and their guests, plus special invitees.  It is not open to the general public. 


See you there! 

Milton & Savona

results.description:
The cost for each class is $20.00 which includes 3-6 hours of class time. Includes all the paper supplies needed to create your Make and Take copy of each project and a glass of wine while you learn fun ways to create beautiful handmade card & paper crafting projects. 

Just bring your favorite adhesive (tape runner, wet glue and/foam pop up tape.)

Each class will start with a look the samples and a quick rundown of the techniques used for each of the projects for the night. 

I will show you step by step how to construct each. In the process you get to "play" with Stampin’ Up! products and learn about many of the tools and supplies that are used in the world of card making and paper crafting.

You get a supplies sheet listing the sizes & dimensions of the project, stamp sets, dies and tools used during the class and an Exclusive YT web address to a video demo of the class' projects only class attendees can access (videos stay exclusive for 1 year).  

TENTATIVE THEMES FOR 2016

• January's Classes: Love(Valentine's Day) / Wet Embossing & Coloring

• February's Classes: Springtime(Easter) / Interactive Cards

• March's Classes: Birthdays & Special Days / Layers & Punches

• April's Classes: Just Because / Multi-Step Stamping & Backgrounds

• May's Classes: Congratulations(Graduations & Weddings) / Fancy Folds

• June's Classes: Thinking of You / Inking & Stencils

• July's Classes: Any Occasion / Dry Embossing

• August's Classes: Back to School / Non-traditional sizes & Easels

• September's Classes: Spooky Fun(Halloween) / Die Cutting

• October's Classes: Family Gatherings(Thanksgiving) / Using Punches

• November's Classes: Holiday Wishes(Christmas/Hanukkah) / Shakers

• December's Classes: Inspirational(New Year) / Monochromatic White

* Each Class (same theme/design) will be held 3 times a month.

** Class will be cancelled if there are less than 3 participants or for personal emergency.

*** Please make sure you are subscribed to organizer's messages.

Need more information or would like to suggest a theme or project... please feel free to send me a message.

results.description:
Hello! 


Our next laser class is on Jan 16th.  Register here, or the class may be full when you arrive!

http://civicrm.fatcatfablab.org/civicrm/event/info?reset=1&id=9

$45 for non-members. free for members. 

YOU MUST HAVE PRIOR DESIGN SOFTWARE EXPERIENCE(Illustrator, Cad, Sketchup or other modeling program is fine)

BRING YOUR COMPUTER IF YOU CAN!

Learn the ins and out of how to use our beloved Trotec and take a simple object that you design and make in the class!

results.description:
Thanks to everyone who came to the street action @ Ground Zero last weekend.  We are at Ground Zero Saturdays  to inform the public about 9/11 Truth, globalization and the threats to our liberties. We have some flyers and cd's ...bring what you can...or just as you are!!!


The street action will begin around 3:00pm and end close to 630pm. This week's action will be followed by an important business meeting and/or continued action at locations TBD.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the info boards
results.name: Street action at Ground Zero

results.description:
Prepay here:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=UAC58MMY79XFL

=============================================

On this tour of Tribeca, in addition to visiting the art galleries, we will also be exploring the "applied arts" as we check out the showrooms of the Design District. There we will see everyday things, such as furniture, lighting, clothing or electronics, ingeniously created to be works of art while still retaining their functionality.

The tour will be led by Savona Bailey-McClain, founder and executive director of the West Harlem Art Fund, an organization that promotes art and culture in parks and other open spaces across NYC, as well as galleries. She has been involved in numerous public art installations and was recently selected to join TINA, a new international network for contemporary art curators based in Italy. In addition, she hosts "State of the Arts NYC", a weekly radio program airing Fridays on WBAI, 99.5 FM.

IMPORTANT: 

- Prepay here:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=UAC58MMY79XFL

- If you tried to use the above link but had trouble with Paypal, an alternate payment link on Brown Paper Tickets will be emailed upon request. This will require an extra $1 charge to help cover the higher fees with this processor. 

- On January 15 (one day before), the price will go up to $25 if the event has not sold out.  Purchasing your spot as early as possible is recommended.

- RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your spot or lock in the price.

- Online payment deadline is 10:30am on the day of the tour.

- If space is available, payment can be made on-site ($25, cash only).

- Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled).  However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place.  At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.

- Take the A/C/E line to Canal Street, but exit the station at Walker Street. Meeting point is just past (north of) the subway entrance on 6th Avenue.

- If you are late or having trouble finding the group, call or text (917) 680-0656.  This is not a smartphone, so posting comments or sending messages through the Meetup site will NOT work.

- Please remember to bring photo ID in case it is requested by security at some of the galleries.

- Feel free to bring your camera.  Taking pictures is allowed.

- The tour will last one and a half to two hours.  Afterward, we will go somewhere nearby for food and socializing if there is interest.

- Gratuities are welcomed. 

- Art novices are welcome, as are people with extensive art backgrounds.

- This event is exclusively for members of my meetup groups and their guests, plus special invitees.  It is not open to the general public. 


See you there! 

Milton & Savona

results.description:
The Brooklyn Museum has a special photo exhibit featuring Coney Island. It looks like very interesting and I am excited to check it out.

Brooklyn Museum has a suggested donation. I will wait in the front lobby area for about 15 minutes. We will then go directly to the exhibit. Stragglers can find us there. Afterwards we may check out another exhibit and then get lunch.


For more information:

https://www.brooklynmuseum.org/exhibitions/coney_island_american_dreamland
results.name: Coney Island Photo Exhibit @ the Brooklyn Museum

results.description:
Who's up for a chilling round of putt-putt at Monster Mini Golf? The ghoulish decorations and black light glow make this place a perfect environment for a mid-winter indoor activity! There's 18 holes of mini golf to work your way through, and stick around afterwards as we grab a bite at a nearby diner. If you have ideas for other ways to stay active and have fun, we want to know about it so that we can incorporate them into future meetups. If you've been a member for awhile or just signed up, this is a great opportunity to meet other members, and stay active during the winter season. I can't wait to see you all there!

What to bring:

Yourself
$10 for a round of golf
Great ideas for upcoming meetup activities
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be hanging around the registration desk, just flag down Matt, Scott, or Josh
results.name: Mid-winter Monster Mini Golf!

group.name: Active Life for a Healthy Mind

results.description:
A celebration to welcome in the new year-- with other veg families in our community. We'll have music, a nature craft table for kids, and lots of delicious food. Please bring a vegan dish to share-- homemade or store-bought is fine. I'll bring utensils, plates, etc. (Also, to be more eco-friendly, please bring your own water bottles if possible.)

Saturday, Jan 16th
3-6pm
Westbeth Artist Housing--Community Room
55 Bethune St (West Side Highway)

$5-10 per family to cover the cost of the space and paper goods.

Looking forward to a beautiful new year celebration with veg friends! -Robyn 🎉
results.name: New Year Family Potluck

Au plaisir de faire votre connaissance!

Ingrid

results.description:
Hi, this meeting is not only for beginners but also for the person who wants to go further by Dhama Teachings and Meditation.

I will explain what is the goal of our meditation and how you can reach there! But it is not easy way! It takes at least a couple year for those who starts their discipline now.

However, don't worry about it. It is professional way that Buddha taught for monks and nuns who devoted their lives to have theirselvesemancipation by freeing from worthy desires, mainly "The Six Delusions", but of course there is way for non-professional way for attain Happiness.

So still you can enjoy it. See you:-)!!
results.name: To Attain Arhat State

group.name: Change Yourself & Change the World - Part 2

results.description:
This is an open house and introduction to Teaneck Meditation. This introduction gives hope for those seeking happiness, peace, and truth. At Teaneck Meditation we use a very simple, yet direct way of cleansing and freeing the mind. This meditation is a customized guided one-on-one practice through self-reflection. Give your mind and heart a break from the chaos of everyday life! Deeply examine and empty your self to find absolute peace and freedom! If you are interested in becoming a member of our meditation center we will offer a special discounted price for meetup members only! 

We are located at 475 Cedar Lane Teaneck, NJ 07666. Our meditation center is located next to Veggie Heaven. Metered parking is in the front, and additional free parking is located in the back of the shopping strip. This introduction will last about an hour to an hour and a half. If you have many plans for the day please say this before the meetup starts so we can accomodate you properly. 

**If you are not able to attend this event, but have an interest in Teaneck Meditation you can call our center to have a personal introduction today! Teaneck Meditation is a non-profit organization and is tax deductible. A $10 donation is appreciated for the introduction. 

* 


475 Cedar Lane Teaneck, NJ 07666 
[masked]

Rivington Music Rehearsal Studios 
188 Stanton Street, New York, NY 
Studio 4

Come join us for our music meetup. A gathering of musicians and singers of all levels, all types of music, amateur or professional in a studio space at Rivington Music Rehearsal Studios. The location can be mapped here. 

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Rivington+Music+Rehearsal+Studios/@40.7200783,-73.9833467,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c25981fb5b2301:0xb63fe55334c476fc 

Please note that in order to keep my expenses low for the meetup, I will begin to charge $8.00/person for the meetup. The fee will be collected at the rehearsal space. All overages over the costs of the meetup will be used towards future meetups to extend time and other future projects.

We will be working on a few songs which are listed below. We are open to requests, so please chime in with your RSVP on what you would like to play and we can accommodate. If you are having issues finding where to add this information in your RSVP. Please leave a message below and indicate what you like to work on.

More information on the studio and the the equipment included are here....

https://www.rivingtonmusic.com/studios/studio-4/#info

We are having our next meetup next week from 3:15 to 5:45PM on Saturday, January 8, 2016. Hope you can all make it. Date and time are subject to change. If you would like to suggest a different venue or day or time. Please let me know. We will see what we can do. 

The songs we will be working on are below. Sheet music, lyric sheets, and Chord Charts are all in a zip for each song and will be linked to the song shortly (if not already).

Pride (In The Name of Love) by U2

Naive by The Kooks

Little Red Corvette by Prince

I Wanna Be Sedated by The Ramones

Are You Gonna Be My Girl by Jet

Learn to Fly by Foo Fighters

You're A God by Vertical Horizon

Sex on Fire by Kings of Leon

If I Fell by The Beatles

Every Breath You Take by The Police

Comfortably Numb by Pink Floyd

Wish You Were Here by Pink Floyd

Looking forward to meeting you all!

results.description:
Come on down to the Colorado Cafe, New Jersey's premiere country dance club and sports bar.  This event usually sells out and is a night you won't want to miss!

When 8minuteDating gets started, you'll have four 8-minute one-on-one conversations with singles in your age group followed by a 20-minute intermission where you can mix and mingle with other singles (from this and its sister events - ages 35 - 49 & 45 - 59) that might have caught your eye. After the intermission, you'll have four more 8-minute dates. That's 8 great dates in one fun night!

You'll enjoy delicious complimentary appetizers, ice breaker games, a cash bar and lots of raffle prizes.  Plus after you've met all of your dates, you can be our guest (a $10 value) in the dance hall for a great night of country dancing.  There will be free dance lessons, a country dj, a live rock band in the sports bar and an amazing night for everyone!

It's sure to be a great night and we guarantee you'll meet someone you want to see again or your next event is on us!  So sign up soon because space is limited and advance registration at 8minuteDating.com is required.

Click here to register: http://www.8minutedating.com

My meetup group members can receive a $5 discount by entering promo code 8mdnynj5 in the appropriate space when registering at 8minuteDating.com!

results.description:
Let's explore the Met together every other Saturday with as little pressure as possible.

Go in the 81st entrance (not up the big stairs), and head straight back to the Uris Center for Education. We'll be at the set of benches (#8) in the middle on the left inside the room. At 4:15pm we will split up.

We'll decide who will go see what with whom, wander galleries, and meet at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30pm for cocktails, mocktails, and small plates to chat. We'll get tables at 5:40pm.

Everyone is responsible for their own admission and tab. I recommend you bring cash for your tab to make settling the check easier.

results.description:
Today we will be focused and immersive in a specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will be drawing our own 'Body Horror'. For those unfamiliar with this term it basically means creating a horror based on using parts of the body. Creating a horror with a physical form with anything such as multiple eyes, multiple limbs, missing body parts, diseased body parts, mutated or deformed body parts, body parts where they shouldn't be, exaggerated or inverted body parts, the list goes on. With almost endless possibilities imaginable, today we will have fun creating the most abominable horrors we can imagine as a group! 

The meetup will be split into three parts: First sketches and warm-up exercises/conceptual discussion, then an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also feel free to bring any reference material that will help out with the theme in addition to what will be provided.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising, challenging, or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!
results.name: Lets Draw Together! Theme: Fun With Body Horror

results.description:
Eileen McCarren, Tournament Director


Eligible:   All members and guests with at least some experience. 
PLEASE PLAY!  More players equal more fun. No first-time players.

Cost:  Free.

Registration: Each player must register on Meetup by midnight 1/15. This will help Eileen and the committee set up teams in advance.  

4:30 PM Set-up, check-in, and team formation.  

5:15 PM Games begin. Anyone not at the pool by 5:00 PM may be disqualified, as it is very difficult to juggle team makeup and keep them balanced.  PLEASE do not be late.

Team Formation  The Tournament Director and Tournament Committee will make up teams, probably each captained by an A or B player, and aim for roughly equal strength teams with each team having a variety of skills.  We’ll play five-person teams if 20 or more people register; 4-person teams if fewer.

Maximum 1 goal per half per player  Unless all players on team have scored in half

Goalie Limit  A-team quality goalies cannot be primary goalies (may defend against fast breaks only).  Tournament director to categorize.

Goal Multiplier – for all rounds  Each player suggests their own category - but Tournament Director has final determination.

 A & B team levels: each goals = 1 point

 C Team level: each goal = 2 points

Tackling  Each player may announce if they wish to be capsized.  Players who do not wish to be capsized may not capsize others.

ROUND-ROBIN

3 points for win; 1 point draw; 0 points loss

Playoff seeding: Points; Goal differential (max. 4/game); goals

PLAYOFFS - Handicapping


4 plays 1; 2 plays 3

Consolation and championship games playoff handicaps: Teams get ranking differential (4th minus 1st means 4th place team starts with 3 points; 3rd place team starts with 1 point against 2)

Tournament Director is sole arbiter of rules, and may interpret or make up additional rules, for fun or fairness, as she sees fit.

Prizes for Round-Robin & Playoff Champions
