results.description:
Simply put (or on the contrary), how does your being honest/dishonest/general ethics code affect your happiness in the short and long terms, or any other way(s) you look at it? Is the answer to this seemingly simple question situationally dependent, or hold generally true one way or another? Do "white lies" indirectly or directly contribute or take away from your happiness levels? Why? Do each of us tend to lie to ourselves, and if so, why would we do so from the perspective of happiness? How and why do people, whether that include you or not, consciously or subconsciously seek out truth? Is it to subconsciously free ourselves and experience happiness, or do you believe there is something bigger and/or deeper going on? We will explore these questions in addition to others as we put our minds together to have an enjoyable discussion! Please try your best to come on time so as to pick up the conversation and take it far and deep as we can take it collectively.

----

A Conversation About Happiness


Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.how_to_find_us: At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.
results.name: Happiness as it Relates to Our Seeking & Telling Truth, and Lying to Others/Self

results.description:
Hello everyone!

We are using this meetup as an opportunity for new members to get introduced to our wonderful Meetup group.  We encourage both men and women to play!  In order to play, you will need to have attended our Meetup no more than 15 times.  To check, go to your profile and look under "Has Attended" (see pic below).  If you have more than 15, do not sign up please!  Your RSVP will be removed and the organizers will give you the stink eye the next time they see you.

We look forward to seeing new faces on the court!

Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. 

Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! 

Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2016 as we're not a litigious group. 

If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds.  

6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. 

Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.


*****NEW*****

Share your Spotify playlists and tracks with us and we'll play them during gametime!

Send an email to [masked]

And please submit good tunes otherwise we'll be Basketball for the Musically Challenged...

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.name: Happiness as it Relates to Our Seeking & Telling Truth, and Lying to Others/Self

results.description:
Scifi channel has changed names but has it changed all together?  Well lets discuss as we view the new shows for Syfy's 2016 lineup. Come out and join us at the Legion of Doom for: 

Syfy going back to it's roots? New Shows on Syfy Channel

When the Scifi channel first began it was a place for reruns of the original scifi & fantasy tv shows.  As the years progressed it started having it's own original content and providing great shows.  Then the dark days began with the change to SYFY...  However, it looks like they have returned to their glory! Lets see if they can bring back the loyal fans. 


We are going to watch two new shows that have arrived on Syfy and discuss the various shows that are coming out.  In addition we will be watching an episode of Battlestar to remind us as to the greatness that was Scifi channel.

Schedule: 
5:00pm - Social hour, just chill and chat about all things scifi & fantasy
6:00pm - Watch Expanse Ep 1
7:00pm - Watch Dark Matter Ep 1
8:00pm - Watch Battlestar Ep 2 (33) 
9:00pm - Chat about all things scifi & fantasy

Food & Drink: Since we will be watching shows for a while it is important to stay hydrated and well fed, so we are instituting our long standing food and drink policy. There are two options:

1)  An item of your choice (entree, drink, dessert, side dish, etc). It's expected that you spend about $10  to $20 on what you bring.  This will make sure that we all get something good to eat/drink during the event. 

2) Bring $10 cash which would go towards food for the event if needed or all other future events.

Venue: 


The Legion of Doom is a new venue space in Brooklyn made just for geeks! Come check it out!
results.name: Syfy - Going back to its roots? New Shows on Syfy Channel

100 RSVP's across Meetup and Facebook platforms! 

Our last event was truly special! We filled up the space with lovely singles ready to mix & mingle! 

How would you like to go on 30+ micro dates in one night? Oh, the possibilities! Spend your evening with me while I guide you through each round of dates. 

Speed Dating seats sell out quickly  - Preregister via Paypal today to ensure your seat is reserved by visiting

</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E">https://littlegaybook.com/events/lesbian-speed-datingnetworking-2/
</a>

Join Melissa and meet some of NYC & NJ’s most eligible single women for speed dating and networking! Would you rather make friends instead? Come join the fun – there is no pressure. Make romantic, friendship, and even business connections. You can speed-date, speed-friend, or speed network!  


$20 if you preregister for a speed dating seat or 
$25 to sign up at the door (both includes entrance to our singles mixer)

and we provide you with everything you need including pen, clip board, score card and optional questions! 

ATTENTION:  Speed Dating rounds start at 7pm SHARP!  Arrive no later than 6:30 to receive your materials. 


$7.00 Specialty Cocktails Specials! 
$7.00 Beer!! 
$25.00 Hookah!!! 
Yummy Tapas Menu!!!! 

It’s okay if you’re feeling nervous about speed dating because I will guide you from start to finish and give you all the tools you need to succeed! 

<a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E">

Preregister now by clicking here!!

*This is not just a speed dating event - This is a singles mixer too!!*

$5.00 cover to attend mixer only 
6pm - 10pm

Don't want to speed date but still want to have fun? Join us at our singles mixer where we will drop our inhibitions and go out on a limb for love! While the women are speed dating, you can mingle with one another and see what all the speed dating fuss is about! I will be there to help break the ice and make introductions. You never know who you'll meet! Once speed dating rounds are done, we ALL GET TO PARTY TOGETHER and dance the night away! 

If you're nervous about attending a singles event, don't be! Fearless women from all spectrum of the rainbow attend my events and make fun, quality connections - Why Not You?! 


Let's dance the evening away and make lasting connections at this beautiful space tailored for a grown and sexy FUN time! 

**Free admission to our After-Party at the Lengendary Henrietta Hudson!!!! What?! Password will be provided**


How it works:


• Rounds will last approximately 3-5 minutes depending upon the number of participants.
• Scorecards and assigned numbers will be handed out to all speed dating participants. In addition, suggested questions  will be provided to help the tongue-tied and we encourage you to ask your own! Be creative with your questions and more importantly HAVE FUN!
• At the end of the event submit your scorecards to Melissa. She solely will review scorecards. 100% private & confidential! Client privacy is of top concern. When two singles indicate the same level of interest toward each other (2nd date, friendship, business), we will provide each with the other’s contact information via email.

and Voila! 

This event is being cross-promoted over several meetup groups and all over Facebook. The RSVP represented here is NOT indicative of actual participation! 

**Free admission to our After-Party at the Lengendary Henrietta Hudson!!!! What?! Password will be provided**

group.name: NYC & NJ Lesbian Speed Dating Events

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
**Meetup-platsen är bestämd. Om du inte fått någon e-post från mig med platsdetaljer, vänligen hör av dig genom att klicka på det lilla kuvertet till vänster.** 


Den här månaden träffas vi på en restaurang eller krog med bra läge på Manhattan eller Brooklyn. När meetup-platsen är bestämd kommer du att få e-post med platsdetaljer.


Om du vill komma på vår Happy Hour så registrera dig gärna på väntelistan! Om du kan delta i samtal på svenska, norska eller danska utan att prata på engelska, så är möjligheten väldigt stor att du kommer få en plats. (Vårt mål är inte prata engelska från[masked] pm)


Vänligen OSA respektfullt. Vi är en verklig grupp av vänner och våra etikettsregler återspeglar detta. Om du inser att du inte kan komma, vilket är helt ok, så se till att du uppdaterar din OSA.

We will meet this month at a conveniently located restaurant or bar in manhattan or Brooklyn.

At our meetups, conversation is mainly in the Scandinavian language of your choice, and therefore attendance is limited to those who can, at a minimum, hold down a simple conversation in Swedish, Danish or Norwegian. If you have any questions about what this means, please contact us.

Please RSVP respectfully. We are a real group of friends and our etiquette reflects that. If you realize you can't make it, that's fine, just update your RSVP.

We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Once inside, feel free to go through the exhibition at your own pace, either on your own or with your fellow MEETUP members. 


We'll be seeing - - - 

PIXAR: THE DESIGN OF STORY

Presented in the museum’s Process Lab, “Pixar: The Design of Story” will examine the design process behind Pixar Animation Studios and films such as Toy Story, Wall-E, Up, Brave, The Incredibles and Cars, among others. Focusing on the process of iteration, collaboration and research, the exhibition will feature original artwork, including rarely seen hand-drawn sketches, paintings and sculptures, revealing how Pixar develops popular characters, fosters emotional connection to its films and, ultimately, how the design process is at the studio’s core.


Don’t be fooled: Pixar is as much a research firm as it is an animation studio, and a new exhibit at the Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum in New York City does an expert job at showing us how. For Pixar: The Design of Story, the movie studio supplied Cooper Hewitt with 650 renderings, mockups, illustrations, and storyboards of its characters and landscapes, along with background. Taken together, these artifacts illuminate the painstaking level of research that goes into the creation of every character, right down to the folds in an old man’s jacket sleeve, or the texture of the curls in a heroine’s hair.
results.how_to_find_us: This is a multi-meetup group event. Joel will be out front from 5:30 P.M. to 5:55 P.M. with an 8½- by 11-inch MEETUP sign - the size of a piece of typewriter paper. Then, we venture inside. Pay-what-you-wish hours are 6 P.M. to 9 P.M.
results.name: Pixar: The Design of Story on Cooper Hewitt's Pay-What-You-Wish Saturday

--------------------------------------------------------------
As Featured on CNN and in the NEW YORK TIMES
---------------------------------------------------------------

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xscfwC90JDk

Ladies, All of your friends are married, engaged, not around? Would you like to make new friends to go out with as activity partners, meet others in the same situation as you? Well this event is for you! Ladies will mingle, make new friends during some ice breakers, and get some exclusive offers. At the last girls night out events, several of the ladies made great friendships that continue to this day. ------------------------------------------------------------------

What the New York Times said


Marcelle S. Fischler from the New York Times covered our first girls night out event.

Click here

for the full article. Some excerpts from the article include:

"The hardest thing is to establish a circle of friends, a circle of single people," Ms. Cardenas said. "The idea of having a fun time for myself and meeting single women is very attractive. It takes away the scariness of doing the single thing, and puts a fun element in it."

"As the friends they have known from young adulthood commit to relationships, marry and have children, single women in their 30's, 40's and 50's, especially in the suburbs, often find themselves out of the loop. Tagging along with couples becomes awkward, and the common ground of shared experience dwindles. The single friend may feel stuck in a rerun of "Sex and the City" while the married friend has moved on to the Wisteria Lane of "Desperate Housewives."

"A lot of women my age are married or have kids," Dr. Hughes said. "They are just on a different path in their lives. They are not interested in going out or doing anything with the singles scene. I am still looking to go out, to meet men."

Not only would they have a chance to commiserate with other unattached women over fresh fruit, sushi and cucumber water, they would also choose from a menu of pampering treatments, from mini-facials to professional makeup applications, having their hair blown out and attending a group lesson on skin care.

Afterward, relaxed, primped and perhaps bonded, the 18 women would move straight on to the more traditional half of the double-barreled event: a men-and-women singles party at Cirella's, a restaurant in the mall.

"Meeting women and men - it's a good two options," Ms. Cardenas said. "Doing the spa thing, if all goes wrong, you walk away with your facial. If all goes right, you make some new friends. If it goes extremely well, you walk out with a potential guy's phone number or being asked your phone number."

At singles events for men and women, Dr. Hughes said, she often got "that standoffish thing" from other women. So the women-only mixer at the spa was a refreshing change, a chance to be cohorts instead of rivals. "In this kind of situation, it's a lot more relaxed," she said.


Contact us now at (516)[masked] or (718)[masked] with any questions.

results.description:
Okay, we all know a lot of exceptional people. Some of them happen to be single. And a lot of us are always complaining about how we never meet anyone decent to date. Let's get together and do what works when it comes to dating -- meeting people through friends and seeing immediately if there's chemistry.

Our fantastic EWNYC members will review all the great single friends we know and invite a few of them to join us for an evening of fun. Doesn't matter who they are, there is only one criteria that they need and that's to be completely single. The great thing is that these are people whose 100% awesomeness can be vouched for -- none of us are friends with serial killers, right? It's not mandatory but you should probably be single also, you might make a connection here of your own.

The Rules ...

In order to keep the ratio of the sexes somewhat even, we do not want to discourage members from attending if they do not have a friend to come with. For example, if your friends, coworker, gym buddy and lunch mate is busy simply come. Will be your single friend

There are no age restrictions regarding the friends you can bring. EWNYC has members of all ages and who are we to stand in the way of the blossoming of a May-December romance.

If you would like to attend you cannot bring a friend you must come alone. Please contact the organizer. We are a friendly group and enjoy the time in this intimate setting. The organizer needs a single friend (contact her she is on the rsvp list)

A list will be created of all attendees so when RSVP'ing. If you are not able to attend, change your rsvp and do not keep others from attending

Spread The Word ...

I emailed the idea for this event to a few select friends and you would be amazed at how many liked the idea and would like to attend. Start talking to the single people you know and I'm sure you'll get a bunch of enthusiastic responses.

 

Best Regards

EWNYC
results.name: Bring a Single Friend Event

results.description:
(***MEN AND WOMEN ARE WELCOME***) 

Take A Risk: SEX! is an experiential event where you take a risk to share and explore an aspect of your sexuality . 

When we experience ourselves as sexual beings, open to our full flow, pulsing with life energy through our body, we become more creative and feel more deeply connected to ourselves and to others. In this dynamic, interactive evening combining individual work with group process, you will learn techniques to liberate this energy and access more pleasure in your life. These techniques will be demonstrated through individual body readings with select participants who choose to take the risk of revealing a sexual issue and are willing to work through it in a supportive environment with expert guidance. 

Dr. Kincaid uses the teachings of Integral Evolutionary Tantra and the principles of Core Energetics to open up physical blocks and places where life energy doesn’t move. In Integral Evolutionary Tantric teachings and in Core Energetics -- a powerful body-based process -- sexual energy and life force energy are one and the same. Join us with body readings, deep truth, wild goodness, radical personal transformation and, if you dare, the evolution of your own personal enlightenment.

Note: This workshop is for both couples and singles. It does not include nudity or explicit sexual touch. All genders and sexual preferences welcome.

Led by Kristina Kincaid in conjunction with

The Institute of The Integral Evolutionary Tantra

Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska

Admission: $20 

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/take-a-risk-sex-with-dr-kristina-kincaid-tickets-19989610463

When you register or attend, please make a point to tell the facilitator that you heard about this event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup.


Dr. Kristina Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.

results.description:
Welcome to our Medicine Movie Night!!


(Organized by: Oklevueha Native American Church of New York ~ onacny.org)

We will be showing a documentary film in our new screening studio with 8 ft. x  12 ft. huge movie screen and state-of-the-art sound system!

Come and sit with us as we learn about how Amazonian sacred plant medicine (Ayahuasca and other teacher plants) can help humanity heal and awaken. It will be a night of amazing movie experience, Q & A, stories sharing, and community bonding. Light food and refreshment will also be served.

After the movie, we will offer information and answer questions about the sacred plants and how to prepare before joining a ceremony.  There will be experienced ceremonial guides and participants sharing their insights and helpful recommendations on undertaking the shamanic medicine healing journey.

Our selected film will be a surprise ♥ ♥ 

Doors open at 7:00pm, showtime starts promptly at 7:30pm 

Suggested Donation: $10~$15   

At the event, please kindly make an energy-exchange contribution to our host “Art Oasis” as they generously provide the space and food for the night. Your support will help ensure that we can continue to offer more enriching activities, meetings, and prayers for our community. AHO!!!

**We have limited seats. If you have RSVP'd here but are not able to make it to the event, please kindly remove yourself from the "Going" list so others can join. Much much appreciated!**

If you have more questions you can email:   [masked]  or  call:  [masked]   (Wen)

results.description:
Join us for an awesome night of music!


Welcome to all our new members! Glad your all having fun!  An outstanding blend of instruments and vocals all contributed to the awesome sound of some of the best music we've played! We'll be at Classic Quiche in Teaneck again, where the seats are comfortable & the music is hot!

Come early @ 6:00 PM and have dinner! For the full menu, go to www.classicquiche.com.  Experience has shown that all goes smoothly, if only the voices and bass plug in and the rest is acoustic. Do bring mics if you have them.  By all means, if you're playing a solo or finger-picking, temporary amplification is fine! 
We are a friendly, inviting and inclusive group--so join us! 
Download our latest BCAM Songbook by clicking on MORE then FILES section of the Meetup site.

**NOTES 
The restaurant doesn't have a liquor license, so BYOB!

A $5 cover charge will be collected from musicians, 100% of which goes to the venue. 

FOR ALL OTHERS, A $10 MINIMUM FOOD/BEVERAGE CHARGE WILL APPLY**
results.how_to_find_us: www.classicquiche.com/
results.name: Get Together For The Joy Of Music!

results.description:
Join us for Northern New Jersey's January Lock and Key Singles Party! A great non-intimidating way to meet singles in the Northern New Jersey area!

Lock and Key Events are the new, interactive and FUN way to network, meet your match, make new friends....or just to have a great time!

</a>

<a href="http://www.lockandkeyevents.com/NNJ">

Details of our next Meet-up:

January 16th, 2016

</a>

<a href="http://10thstreetlive.com/">

10th Street Live
 104 N. 10th Street
 Kenilworth, NJ 07083

Suggested Age range: 29-55 ( if you are a little younger or older...no biggie!!)

Check-in : 7:00-7:30pm
Mix and Mingle : 7:30-9:30pm
Prize drawing at 9:30pm
Done at 9:30pm and then stay & party until closing with no cover!!

INCLUDES:
- DRINK SPECIALS during the event *, AND FREE APPETIZERS (until 8:30 PM),
- Free admission into 10th Street Live (no additional cover if you stay afterwards)
- Great prizes, and the opportunity to massively mix, mingle, make new friends, and who knows what else!


How It Works
Every woman gets a padlock. Every man gets a key. Your goal is to match the right key with the right padlock. Every time you unlock you get a ticket that enters you into the drawing to win great prizes from our party sponsors. Prizes such as cold hard cash, hotel stays, dinners, tickets to popular things to do and more. After every unlock you get another lock or key so you can get back into the fray and meet more people!

Register at www.lockandkeyevents.com/NNJ!! Use the code CNJMEETUP to attend for ONLY $21 - OUR MEET-UP MEMBERS PAY A MUCH LOWER PRICE TO ATTEND THESE SUPER FUN EVENTS THAN ANYONE ELSE. Or, you can pay $27 CASH at the door IF you put in an RSVP. Otherwise, it's $32 at the door!!

PRIZES!

Every time you unlock, you can win prizes such as:

One $50 CASH Prize!

One - Pair of Tickets to see a Broadway Show <a>TBA</a> ($200 value/pair)

One - Pair of Tickets to see an Off-Broadway Show <a>TBA</a> ($110 value/pair)

One - Gift Certificate for 10th Street Live ($25 value)

Complimentary Admission tickets to  Pre-Dating Speed Dating Events ($35 Value)

Several Copies of the book "No More Dating Pigs - You Are What You Date" by Dating Author Norah Marler ($8.95 value each)

Complimentary Admissions into future Lock And Key Events

And more!

Please email or call me with any questions!!

See you there~
Marcy
(908)[masked] or call[masked] (877-LNK-EVENT)
[masked]

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 27-39 - 1F/1M SPOTS LEFT

results.description:
We have a guitar and mandolin duo from Oregon who will be performing Brazililan choro which developed in the early 20th century in the streets of Rio de Janero. Influenced by Afro-Brazilian rhythms and contemporary cafe music of Italy, Spain and Portugal, Rio Con Brio represents intersection of New World music, classical technique and jazz improvisation.

Concert starts at 8pm but you should arrive at 7:30pm at least! Please RSVP earlier than later in case the event gets fully booked. Snacks and refreshments will be served. I'll be in the space at 6pm getting ready so you're welcome to come earlier and say hello. If you've never been to the Puffin before I'll give you a little tour!
results.name: Brazilian choro: Rio Con Brio

results.name: GMAVC Tournament!

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music (Hustle Room/WCSwing Room & Mixed Ballroom/Latin Room), great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the 8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson or Mixed Social Dancing in an adjacent room. Then the DJ's take over at 9p and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you EXPERIENCED DANCERS, there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor
(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes pre-party class 8-9p.

*To enter building, Press 6 then 'CALL' on the intercom*
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the Mixed Ballroom Room dancing and greeting.
results.name: "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party at Club 412

group.name: The New York Ballroom Dance Meetup

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

group.name: Open Jams NYC at Funkadelic Studios

results.name: THE ELECTRIX @ Still Partners

group.name: Long Island GRATEFUL DEAD Meetup Group

results.description: This safe and inviting space where everyone can feel free to come as they are and move however they want. There is no judgment and the practice has nothing to do with being a "good" dancer. Dance is joyful and powerful, and it's definitely made all the richer when practiced in a group, where we reflect one another's beauty and hold space for each other's pain. To witness each other and to be seen, so that we can move through the world as our most authentic selves. It's a lot of fun, and also really cathartic, as we feel into our bodies and touch into the deepest parts of ourselves...igniting bliss and releasing any blocks we might be holding. This soulful dance party will draw from various traditions that can help fuel an awesome reconnection with body and soul, including 5Rhythms, Authentic Movement, Ancient Temple Arts, Qigong, and Meditation.

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - Trying something new.


Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked]

Stay warm and ride the rails of the NYC Subway System in Manhattan as we bring dozens of Meet Up and Social Networking Groups together for a little fun competition, exploring, socializing even a little learning.  No experience is necessary all you need is a desire to have fun and meet new people!

How it works:

-Registration will happen at 11am at St Pat's Bar and Grill located at 22  west 46th between 5th and 6th.

-We will randomly put together teams of 4- 5 (unless you already have a team)

-Once you are on a team you will be given a sheet of clues and questions where the only places you can find the answers are within the trains and stations of the Manhattan subways. Many of the clues will focus on finding historical info as well as the subway art within the stations (It's not hard stuff, we promise and you will be told which specific station to go to!!)

-Each team will be given a designated amount of time (2 hours) from when they leave to return with as many answers as possible.

-After all teams have returned the groups will come together for food, drinks socializing and sharing experiences while we tally up the results!  The final destination will be selected that day. (near Penn Station)

What kind of stuff will we be looking for? You will be given the specific clues to find at each station and in the subway cars.  Many of the clues will will involve historical elements and the art exhibits in the stations. You will also have to bring back some pictures, trinkets and "trash" from your adventure.  All in good fun.

Can I come alone?  Yes 95% of those attending will likely sign up on their own.  If you come alone we will set you up on a fun team.

How should I dress?  Casual and for the weather although y0u will be underground 98% of the time.

What is the cost?  $10 to participate in the Scavenger Hunt, plus you may need to swipe your metro card 2-3 times. Please bring exact change.

What should I bring?  A camera phone if you have one.  If not no worries.  Bottle of water.

Where will I be traveling to?  You will be traveling on several of the subway lines, transferring trains and exploring some stations. All of the hunt will take place on the subways between 59th street and South Ferry.
results.name: The Great Subways and Stations Art and History Scavenger Hunt

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Entertaining bufflehead ducks have arrived in Brooklyn Bridge Park. Finally!

We'll walk from Pier 1 to Pier 5 as we look for Buffleheads, other winter ducks such as Gadwall, and gulls including the world's largest, Great Black-backed Gull. We're also likely to see White-throated Sparrows doing their double-scratch hop in the park's all-important leaf litter habitat.

Beginners welcome and encouraged!

Bring binoculars if you have them. 

Meet in park where Old Fulton Street ends/intersects with Furman St. (BargeMusic) at 8:30am. Map 

I will be there to lead the walk rain or shine.

Note: I won't be checking my phone for text  or meetup messages once the walk begins. If you arrive after 8:30am, you can call me at[masked] or look for anyone with binoculars walking around Pier 1, especially at south end along East River (near pilings in water).

For birding tips, giveaways, and updates on my upcoming book, sign up for my email list here.

See you Sunday!

~Heather

brooklynbridgebirds.com

We'll take the Short Line bus from Port Authority to Bear Mountain, NY (about 1.5 hours from the city), hike a 4-6 mile trail to some very scenic views, taking a break for lunch along the way, and wrapping up our adventure at the Bear Mountain Inn Tapas Bar before heading back to the city.

Level = Strenuous
Pets okay? = No
Elevation Gain = 1,000 feet
Length = 4-6 miles

Trail type = Loop

When = Sunday 1/17
Trail = Bear Mountain (https://www.trails.com/trailguide.aspx?trailid=HGN205-004&z=1)

Hope you can join! Specifics and more details to be provided once registered.

This event is restricted to 15 spots, hurry and sign up to join! :)

results.description:
Thanks to those that read the posting and messages and showed up. As noted the radar showed the clouds clearing around the start time and that's exactly what happened. It turned out to be a beautiful day, even the sun popped out.

If you're ready for another week of football or if you missed last week then don't skip on this week. There shouldn't be any rain although it won't be as warm as prior weeks. Either way, it's football weather. So if you're not scared of a little cold (which shouldn't be a problem once you're running around) then come join us this Sunday.

Please remember to show up on time!

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year

Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
There is a possibility of snow during the week so I figure it will be nice to do this hike to take advantage of beauty of this place after fresh snow fall.

This hike is classified as intermediate hike but  we are going to welcome enthusiastic beginners for this amazing hike.

Highlights: waterfalls, views, cliffs, ice caves- this hike has it all!

Location: 186 Sams Point Rd, Pine Bush, NY 12566 (Preserve is at the end of the road)
GPS:[masked],[masked])

Distance: 10 miles round trip

Time: 6+ hours

Date: 01/16/2016 Saturday Starting time: 9:00 AM

Difficulty: Moderate

Hike Type: Mostly Loop

Cost: $10.00 per car (carpooling is suggested)

No kids no exceptions.

We will hike at a steady pace with frequent stops at view points over rocky trails and some light rock scrambling. There is 1 steep incline of 200 feet. The hike is long, but the views are fantastic.

Maps: NYNJTC Map #104

Terrain: Rocky and uneven in places. Fairly steep in spots.

Route:

Conservation center – loop road - High point carriage way– Indian rock - High point carriage way – High point trail – Verkeerder Falls – Ice caves (optional)– back to parking lot

Overview
This hike climbs to Sam's Point, with spectacular views, follows a narrow path through the crevices of the Ice Caves, and continues to Verkeerderkill Falls - the highest waterfall in the Shawangunks.

This hike will take you through Sam's Point preserve, previously owned by the Nature Conservancy and now part of Minnewaska state park. The preserve is part of the Shawangunk ridge extending into Minnewaska State Park. We will hike through a rare and endangered ecosystem, consisting of a dwarf pitch pine barren, one of the few remaining in the world. We will also hike to the ice caves which were formed from the boulders from the cliffs, creating huge rock crevices or caves. The air in the caves gets trapped keeping the interior cold enough for snow to stay through July!

http://www.nynjtc.org/hike/ice-caves-and-verkeerderkill-falls

Trailhead GPS Coordinates[masked],[masked]

Things to bring:
Backpack
Headlamp
Plenty of water
Lunch
Snacks

Recommended gear:
Non-cotton
Dry wicking clothing
Hiking boots, no sneakers please
Windbreaker Sunblock
Warm layers

Disclaimer:

Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and hike/trip leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events.

It's winter! Since there is a forecast of "possible" rain and snow - check back here on Saturday evening to see if this run is still scheduled.

This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).


We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a couple of minutes to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

results.description:
FLUENCY PROJECT – FORCED FLUENCY™ ONE-DAY IMMERSION PROGRAM (8 Different Languages!)

One full day (12 HOURS!) of language awesomeness for just $125!   Sunday, January 17th, 2016, 10am - 10pm. 8 languages to choose from, including English! Pick ONE: Chinese (Mandarin), English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Portuguese, Spanish. I chose these languages based on the survey feedback I received, so thanks to those who participated!

AGENDA:

09:45am ARRIVAL (PLEASE ARRIVE BY 9:45 TO GET SETTLED)

10:00am – 10:30am WELCOME, PAPERWORK, WORD LISTS, GRAMMAR POINT, VERB LIST

10:30am – 11:30am INTENSIVE READING 1 (BOOK, MAGAZINE, AND/OR NEWSPAPER + DISCUSSION)

11:30am – 12:30am INTENSIVE WRITING 1 (2 - 4 PAGE ESSAY 750 WORDS, PROMPTS PROVIDED)

12:30pm – 1:00pm LUNCH IMMERSION WITH GROUP (NO ENGLISH UNLESS STUDYING ENGLISH)

1:00pm – 2:00pm INTENSIVE LISTENING 1 (LIVE RADIO, NEWS, AND/OR AUDIOBOOKS + DISCUSSION)

2:00pm – 3:00pm INTENSIVE SPEAKING 1 (HANDS-ON PRACTICE WITH 1 – 2 OTHERS USING PROMPTS)

3:00pm – 3:30pm STUDY HALL (STUDY AS YOU LIKE; MUST USE THIS TIME WELL IN TARGET LANGUAGE)

3:30pm – 4:30pm INTENSIVE READING 2 (NEW READINGS OR CONTINUE EARLIER READINGS, + DISCUSSION)

4:30pm – 5:30pm DINNER IMMERSION WITH GROUP (NO ENGLISH UNLESS ENGLISH IS TARGET LANGUAGE)

5:30pm – 6:30pm INTENSIVE LISTENING 2 (LIVE NATIVE SPEAKER + DISCUSSION)

6:30pm – 7:00pm INTENSIVE WRITING 2 (REVIEW CORRECTIONS AND GRAMMAR POINTS PROVIDED BY NATIVE SPEAKER)

7:00pm – 8:00pm INTENSIVE SPEAKING 2 USING PROMPTS

8:00pm – 8:30pm WRAPUP; STUDY COMMITMENTS; FEEDBACK; NEXT STEPS

8:30pm –10:00pm STUDY HALL, SOCIALIZATION, & CELEBRATION TIME (ALL LANGUAGES)---You may leave at 9pm if you must. Please commit to at least 9pm. You may not leave earlier than that except for an emergency.

SPEAKING/LISTENING REQUIREMENTS:
* You must already speak/understand at a LOW INTERMEDIATE or higher level.
(Low Intermediate = can have general conversations with native speakers without too much difficulty)
* Why so high? Because if you can’t converse, your partner(s) are going to be upset with you, hee hee. :)

READING/WRITING REQUIREMENTS:
* You must already read/write at a BEGINNER or higher level.
(Beginner = can survive in the country if you could not speak any other language)
* Why so low? Because this is mostly an individual activity, so your level will not impact others too much.  It's up to you how you feel about reading advanced texts.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:
* You need a smartphone or tablet with wifi capability.
* You need to bring earphones.
* You need one or two books/magazines you are reading, plus any grammar or vocabulary references you like to use.
* You need to agree to speak your target language 98% of the time.  You CANNOT be lazy.
* You need to bring a notebook.
* You need to bring pencils with a good eraser OR erasable pens.  You will NOT be allowed to write your essay with normal pens OR on a computer.
* You need to agree to stay for the entire event.
* You need to agree to faithfully participate in all events to the best of your ability.

Cost: $125.

Why: You get TWELVE HOURS of forced fluency practice, including a live native speaker (for one hour) who will also correct your writing exercises; plus intensive writing practice, intensive speaking practice, intensive listening practice, and intensive reading practice—ALL WITHIN VERY SMALL GROUPS OF 2 – 3 PEOPLE THAT REALLY ALLOWS YOU TO WORK. You will learn more in this one day than you could in an entire five-week language course AND it is far less expensive! You will leave this advanced intensive with better reading skills, writing skills, listening skills, and speaking skills—GUARANTEED—or your money back* (*See refund policy below). So THAT’S what you’re paying for. As a bonus, you will also meet others who are just as serious about language learning as you are, and hey, that’s always a good thing. Designed by a world-traveling language junkie PhD Psychology student (3 months from graduation) who truly understands what it takes to become fluent. This will be a day filled with joyfully fun and abundantly serious language mastery lessons that will stay with you for the rest of your life.

For Who: For someone (like you?) who is unequivocally serious about finally devoting the time and effort towards becoming fluent in your chosen foreign language. This one-day intensive is as intense (and probably more so) than an advanced foreign language course at university. This course will force you to do the sometimes boring and always difficult exercises and activities that you NEED to do in order to master a foreign language. During these very intensive 12 hours, you will be FORCED to read, write, speak, and listen, in a fun (but organized and firm) environment that leads to guaranteed results. You will also be treated to a 30-minute speech by a native speaker, speaking at normal speed. A native speaker (or language expert) will also be there to correct your 750-word written essay, so you will leave knowing where you made your mistakes.

WARNING: this course is not for lazy people and NOT for beginners. It WILL be exhausting; it WILL be tiring; and that's good because directly as a result, it WILL end up being (quite probably) the most practical and useful foreign language course you have ever experienced. All in just one day.  Pretty awesome if I say so myself, and yup, I'll be participating too!

REFUND POLICY:
* At least two students are required for each language. If you end up being the only one who wishes to study a particular language, you will be given a full refund.
* If you pay, show up, but a partner does not show up, you will be given a refund, and also a $25 discount towards the next event.
* You will NOT be given a refund if you simply cancel after paying--others are counting on your being there, so you need to commit. This policy is my way to help ensure that it is more likely you will attend. If there is a serious medical or family emergency, please provide a note from your doctor or other official verifying this fact. Otherwise, I suggest you just attend (haha) or transfer your registration to a friend who speaks the same language (with our permission). Please try to respect your fellow students (and me!) who are counting on you being there.
* If you pay, but on the day of the immersion, simply do not show up, you will NOT be given a refund because others were counting on you to be their language partners.
* If you pay, attend the event, and participate in all exercises and then truly feel the course did not improve your language skills in any measurable way, you will be given a full refund. However, before paying, you agree to read the course description above in full, and fully acknowledge that this is not a traditional language class—much of the work will be forced solitary or group practice. Do NOT attend this course if you expect to be spoon fed everything. One of the main purposes of this program is to force intermediate and advanced students to do the things they typically do not do by themselves on a regular basis. “All we did is read and write and talk to one another and listen to audio” is not a valid reason for “not meeting your expectations”—um, that is precisely the purpose of this course and precisely what will help develop your fluency! That being said, please go into this knowing what to expect.

I look very much forward to seeing many of you on the 17th!

-Monroe Mann, Esq. 
Founder, Fluency Project 


P.S. - In answer to your question, "Why are you charging for a meetup?", my response is, "My dear, why should you get this for free?" :D  Most meetups are a colossal waste of time, and are ineptly organized.  This event will be impeccably organized, and expertly driven, and that should already be clear.  I've spent tens and tens of hours putting this together, and will spend even more time and money creating the materials.  The space costs more than $200.  The survey cost over $200.   Meetup takes 10% more or less for the credit card fees.  I will have to pay the native speakers to attend.  My time too is incredibly valuable (don't you agree, haha?).  Bottom line, I have already lost over $300 with this meetup group, and that ends now.  If you want to go to a free meetup, by all means do so: you will not likely ever become fluent by doing so.  My event WILL help you gain fluency, and $125 is extremely generous given all that you will receive.  I know I could charge twice if not thrice this amount and still feel good about myself. :D  But my hope is to keep the fee as low as possible while also paying expenses.  Hope this answers your question!
results.name: FORCED FLUENCY™ ONE-DAY IMMERSION PROGRAM (EIGHT DIFFERENT LANGUAGES!)

results.description:
Dance Walk your heart out in January 2016! Bring your own ipod & earbuds--everybody listens to their own music as we dance walk around the park loop. What is dance walking? It's an improvised form of walking, with music, doing whatever movement comes naturally. It's walking and moving your arms. Or skipping, skitching, low-stepping, sideways running. It's responding to the rhythm, attitude, or story of the music you're hearing. In short, it's having a dance party in your living room, while walking through the park--hilarious and exhilarating. For inspiration, check out:

www.24hoursofhappy.com

The first hour of practice is dedicated to beginners, so if three hours is daunting, you may come for the first hour and leave after that. All are welcome!

Practice is lead by senior teachers Tina LaGreca and Jake La Botz and occasional visiting teachers. For more information about our teachers see the  "About Us" section.

We have a suggested donation of $10 to $20 to support the space and the teachings. No one will ever be turned away for lack of funds.

SOUTH MOUNTAIN RESERVATION, Milburn, South Orange and West Orange, NJ

To Tulip Springs: From Northfield Ave. go south on Cherry Lane (Name changed from Pleasant Valley Way but same road) toward Millburn 0.8 miles to entrance on left. Free QuickBooks On-the-Cloud Class For The Small Business Owner

5 Hour Live, In-Person Training In Manhattan On Sunday, January 17th, 10:30am to 4pm. 


Running your business takes time. QuickBooks cloud accounting makes it easy!Learn how to manage your business finances like a Pro in our interactive, live class in NYC!


Our basic training is specifically designed to teach small business owners how to manage finances, save time and be more profitable using QuickBooks online.

You will learn how to:


• Create professional invoices apply payments and track A/R

• Pay your bills, print checks and manage A/P

• Reconcile bank accounts

• Track income, expenses

• Analyze profitability

• Prepare financial reports 

• Develop insight about your company finances


*** Attendees can bring laptops. 

Registration link: 

http://www.bookkeepingservice-nyc.com/free-quickbooks-class


Registration is required. Class is limited to 15 people. Registration confirmation must be presented to enter class room. Only 1 person from company may attend. Registration ends on January 15th. 


Training sponsored by OnPoint Business Solutions, Inc. Your instructor will be Milana Lieberson, a Certified QuickBooks Expert

results.description:
Uncover the power of a quieter mind and ensure the renewal of a healthier you through movement, breath, and meditation. I welcome each student to come escape the bustle of the city to experience above and find their inner guru in my  class!

WELCOME 2016! 

As we welcome 2016, let's plant the seed and watch it grow together!  While the air is (finally) crisping and the wind is whispering coming of the snowy tides, it's a perfect opportunity to recuperate, hibernate, and seek introspection.  Come slow and quiet down with us in a weekly cozy practice to balance the Vata (movement/air) dosha and learn how you can best take care of yourself in order to blossom in the Spring...  


Since March 2013, this donation based Meet Up group has aimed to provide a light-hearted and non-competitive space.  One can expect clear instructions, demonstration, gentle hands-on assistance, and achieve greater flexibility, strength, balance, focus, and sense of ease with regular attendance.  

Extra mats and blocks are limited, kindly bring yours if you have them.


*To offset Meetup Organizer's fees, a suggested donation between $7-10 will be greatly appreciated*

Thank you and please do post any questions.  I hope to see you soon! 

Jennifer ( 500 Hour Yoga Alliance Registered  Teacher)
