This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
http://nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/mlkpanel.jpg?itok=Fq0uA19W Panel

Dr. Anne Klaeysen, Leader presides 

Dr. Martin Luther King Remembrance Day: A panel discussion with David Rothenberg, founder of The Fortune Society; Bob Gangi, founder of the Police Reform Organizing Project (PROP); and Kyung-Ji Kate Rhee, juvenile justice director of the Center for NuLeadership on Urban Solutions. 

Our annual remembrance keeps the memory and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. lively for us. This year we emphasize a society goal of humanizing criminal justice by hosting a panel discussion with leaders in this field. 

David Rothenberg founded The Fortune Society in 1967; its vision is to create a world where all who are incarcerated or formerly incarcerated can become positive, contributing members of society. Using research and analysis, public education, policy advocacy and coalition-building, 

PROP works to expose and correct abusive police tactics that routinely and disproportionately do harm to our city’s low-income communities and people of color. 

The Center for NuLeadership on Urban Solutions is an independent research, training and advocacy Human Justice think tank, founded and developed by academic professionals with prior experience within the criminal punishment system. It is the first of its kind in the country.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
Join us Sunday, January 17th, at 11AM for an interactive panel discussion on the world of transmedia as we look at the past, examine the now and prepare for the future of cross-platform storytelling.

Expert transmedia producers will present insights and updates on working in the transmedia space including how to develop your own transmedia projects from writing, to team building, to distribution.


Come and engage in a lively group discussion with the panelists and a Q&A session afterwards.


Some of the event topics include:


Developing a transmedia project from inception through completion

Building a transmedia team: The do’s and don’ts

Festivals: Which ones, and why?

How to find distribution for your transmedia project

What technologies are available for creating transmedia projects?

Explore how the future of storytelling can dramatically change the way we interact with non-linear story experiences

Leave with a full understanding of why and how transmedia is one of the most important arsenals for any storyteller wanting to engage an audience in their storyworld


Don’t forget to come prepared with questions for the discussion part of the event!

Panelists include:


Vladan Nikolic


Vladan Nikolic is an independent filmmaker and associate professor at the School of Media Studies at The New School, where he teaches filmmaking and transmedia production classes. He has made numerous feature films and documentaries, which have screened, won awards and critical acclaim in the US and internationally, including at the Venice Film Festival, Tribeca, Barcelona, Geneva, Moscow, London, etc. In 2010 he directed and produced the feature film Zenith, which is also part of an extensive transmedia project. The film has been released in a unique and innovative way, combining theatrical, video, and online releases over multiple platforms, receiving millions of downloads, and a cult following. Vladan has worked and consulted on a variety of transmedia projects since, from film-related to educational platforms, including for the Icelandic government and the Hong Kong Design Institute. He is currently writing a book on digital filmmaking and transmedia, to be published by Focal Press.


Natalie Braxton


Natalie Braxton is a fine and new media artist and award winning storyteller.  In addition to her own work, she helps people and projects craft stories for the right audience. She has worked with a number of marketing agencies including in Imagination Ltd, Campfire and TRBI (now Ipsos). Previous clients include the BBC and Ford Motors. Natalie is the co-founder, with Dorothee Olivereau, of The InVisible Content, a production company developing new media stories.  


Honors include MA Scriptwriting Goldsmiths College (UK), University of London, BA (Hons) in Graphic Design, Camberwell College of Art (UK), BA Interactive New Media from the Gallatin division of NYU (US).


James Carter


James Carter is a writer and experience designer. He was a founding member of terraNOVA Collective and its associate artistic director for eight years. Recent multi-platform plays include "FEEDER: A Love Story" (terraNOVA/HERE, NYC) and "NY_Hearts" (One Muse Presents & The Brick Game Play Festival). James also works as a social impact strategy and research consultant for Lina Srivastava, LLC and teaches digital storytelling to youth and young adults with MIRA. He has written for the Creators Project, Culturadar.com, ArtsFwd and Theatre Communications Group.
results.name: State of the Story: Transmedia Past, Present and Future

results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 12-12:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff? 
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday. 

What time does the run actually start?
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer that 11:15am.  

What happens after the run?
After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food! Weather permitting, we can get something to eat from Whole Foods (or wherever you like), and we can sit and eat in the park. We can walk over to the Sheep Meadow.
If the weather is not picnic-friendly, we can hit our goto place which is Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

** only RSVP 'No' if you were previously a 'Yes'.
results.how_to_find_us: behind the USS Maine Monument (gold statue)

results.description:
Join us as artist Betty Yu discusses her work at the cHURCH. This is a free event and bagels and coffee will be served.


Betty Yu is a Chinese-American NYC based filmmaker, multi-media artist, media educator and longtime social justice activist. Her documentary “Resilience” about her garment worker mother fighting against sweatshop conditions, screened at national and international film festivals including the Margaret Mead Film and Video Festival. Betty’s interactive multi-media installation, “The Garment Worker” was part of a 5 week art exhibit in Chinatown in 2013, and featured at Tribeca Film Institute’s Interactive 2014. Betty was a 2012 Public Artist-in-Resident with the Laundromat Project and is a 2015 Cultural Agent with the U.S. Department of Arts and Culture (USDAC) a people-powered network.


Betty is currently on the Board of Directors of Working Films, Deep Dish TV and Third World Newsreel, three progressive media arts centers that distributes and exhibits social issue films. Betty’s work has been exhibited, screened and featured at the International Center of Photography, The Directors Guild of America, Brooklyn Museum and The Eastman Kodak Museum. In addition, Betty has more than 15 years of community, media justice and labor organizing in NYC’s Chinatown. Betty’s organizing recognitions include being the recipient of the Union Square Award for grassroots activism and a semi-finalist of the National Brick “Do Something” Award for community leadership in Chinatown.
results.name: cHURCH OF MONIKA: Betty Yu

group.name: The Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
Title: Being an Ally

Speaker: Jone Johnson Lewis, Leader, Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture

Details: In the history of social justice efforts, often allies have been crucial parts of campaigns to empower those who are oppressed or discriminated against.  But beinganally is a tricky proposition. It’s very easy for the privilege we have to also play out in our attempts to be helpful, and to replicate the power-over dynamic even as we think we’re being helpful.  But it’s also not helpful, or necessary, to simply get out of the way, and expect those who are beingoppressed to solve all their own problems alone. Beinganally can be uncomfortable, but it’s also an important part of empowering social change.  We’re likely all allies in some efforts, and in others, we may welcome effective allies.

Leader Jone Johnson Lewis will explore how and why to be effective allies.

About the Speaker: Jone Johnson Lewis is the clergy Leader of the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. Jone has been an Ethical Culture Leader since 1991, serving Ethical Societies in Chicago, Northern Virginia and Brooklyn. She's currently the President of the National Council of Leaders and a member of the American Ethical Union's Membership Committee. 

More information: http://www.rysec.org/event/being-an-ally
results.how_to_find_us: www.rysec.org/directions/

Dr. Eric Lane will give a talk entitled:

The need for civic education to maintain a rigorous democracy

Dr. Lane is the Dean and Eric J. Schmertz Distinguished Professor of Public Law and Public Service School Of Law Hofstra University. He is the coauthor with Michael Oreskes, managing editor for U.S. news for the Associated Press, ofThe Genius of America: How the Constitution Saved the Country and Why It Can Again. Dean Lane is well-known beyond the Hofstra campus for his work in public service. He has previously served as the senior fellow at the Brennan Center for Justice at New York University School of Law. In that role, he wrote the report (with Meg Barnette) A Report Card on New York’s Civic Literacy, which was published in April 2011.

results.name: SHSNY Brunch & Conversation

results.description:
Hi everyone and happy new year! This upcoming Sunday we'll be talking about the protests that have erupted in Europe (Germany specifically) following mass New Year's Eve attacks on women in Cologne. Of course, this is all backgrounded by the refugee crisis and Paris terrorist attacks.

We'll follow up with a discussion of the economy's grand tanking last week, the worst stock market performance to start the year ever, and the slowly escalating standoff between Oregon protesters and local/regional/federal government. It's easy to pigeonhole the Oregon protests into general anti-government resistance, but given the historic tensions over land in the West is it really the same thing?

And I doubt we'll be able to hold a Current Events Coffee without discussing the Elections for basically a year, so might as well embrace it!

Looking forward to kicking off 2016!
results.name: Tensions in Europe, the Economy, Oregon Standoff, and Elections (of course)

results.description:
IMPROV FOR ACTORS - Express Yourself

This Improv for Actors workshop will focus on expressing emotions. You will learn techniques that will help you work through emotional blocks and freely express emotions. 

Many actors are more comfortable expressing anger or apathy than they are expressing more vulnerable emotions such as sadness, fear or even love. Through exercises, theater games and scene work you will practice expressing a variety of emotions so you can expand your emotional range and have more choices as a performer.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations. 


THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV


Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.


*Suggested Donation: $15 (most improv classes cost $35-$50 ea. in NYC.)

*Free drink with $15 donation
results.name: Express Yourself

results.description:
Get ready for crazy fun and lots of laughs as you play the Room Escape Game!  We will put together a team and you and your teammates will enter a room, find the clues, solve the puzzles and work together in order to escape!! 

How it works/ Itinerary: 
The games starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle at Noon at a local bar/pub (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and break up into teams. 

PREPAY ONLY EVENT ($39-$49 depending upon how early you purchase ticket) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/roomescape/

Play one of the following games:

• You are Dr. Watson trapped in a mysterious room. Unfortunately, Sherlock Holmes can't help because he is somewhere else - he's waiting for you to join him in tracking down the hound of the Baskervilles, the adventure of your lives. Escape before time runs out!

• An ultra-intelligent Big Bad Wolf has trapped your team in his magical forest! And one of your teammates is locked away from the rest. Note: HE WON'T BE IDLE. He will collaborate with other team members to solve puzzles and earn his freedom. After the team is reunited, they work together to escape the forest! 

• You are trapped in a sequence of dreams of a troubled individual, the kind of character from an Edgar Allan Poe story. You will be taken to visit the dreamer's past, present and future. Get ready to solve puzzles made from optical illusions, special visual effects and hidden imagery. Your goal is to escape from this man's subconscious!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT.  MUST PURCHASE TICKET HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/roomescape/

results.name: Room Escape Singles Game & Pre-Mingle (PREPAY ONLY)

results.description:
Prepay required at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5967

Sunday: January 17, 2016 @ 2 PM
Pre-mingle at Noon
$39-$49 depending on how early you register.

This event is NOT meant to be age specific or gender balanced.
**Exclusive Private event for our group!  We will have approximately 30 people and break into groups of 10. 

Get ready for 60 minutes of crazy fun, team building and lots of laughs as you - as you play one of the escape games!  You and your team mates will enter a room,  find the clues, solve the puzzles and work together in order to escape....

How it works/ Itinerary
The games starts at 2 PM SHARP, however we will have a pre-mingle at Noon  at a local bar/pub (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and break up into teams.


The Games 

You are Dr. Watson trapped in a mysterious room. Unfortunately, Sherlock Holmes can't help because he is somewhere else - he's waiting for you to join him in tracking down the hound of the Baskervilles, the adventure of your lives. Escape before time runs out!

================================================

An ultra-intelligent Big Bad Wolf has trapped your team in his magical forest! And one of your teammates is locked away from the rest. Note: HE WON'T BE IDLE. He will collaborate with other team members to solve puzzles and earn his freedom. (If the team is clever, his exodus typically happens within 10 minutes) After the team is reunited, they work together to escape the forest! 

=====================================================

You are trapped in a sequence of dreams of a troubled individual, the kind of character from an Edgar Allan Poe story. You will be taken to visit the dreamer's past, present and future. Get ready to solve puzzles made from optical illusions, special visual effects and hidden imagery. Your goal is to escape from this man's subconscious!

REVIEW FROM YELP


I was there a month ago and went back for the second time last week. Tried two of their three escape games and found both great fun, well-designed and thought provoking. I really like how each room has a theme and how puzzles were revealed. It is obvious that the owner gave lots of thoughts into his games.

You will love this if you like riddles and enjoy a fun challenge. It is also a great icebreaker for someone who you have not met or getting to know  deft no regrets and this will give you a sense of achievement if you are able to ESCAPE!!

Prepay required at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5967

$39-$49 depending on how early you register.

Get ready for crazy fun and lots of laughs as you play the Room Escape Game!  We will put together a team and you and your teammates will enter a room, find the clues, solve the puzzles and work together in order to escape!! 

How it works/ Itinerary: 
The games starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle at Noon at a local bar/pub (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and break up into teams. 

PREPAY ONLY EVENT ($39-$49 depending upon how early you purchase ticket) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/roomescape/

Play one of the following games:

• You are Dr. Watson trapped in a mysterious room. Unfortunately, Sherlock Holmes can't help because he is somewhere else - he's waiting for you to join him in tracking down the hound of the Baskervilles, the adventure of your lives. Escape before time runs out!

• An ultra-intelligent Big Bad Wolf has trapped your team in his magical forest! And one of your teammates is locked away from the rest. Note: HE WON'T BE IDLE. He will collaborate with other team members to solve puzzles and earn his freedom. After the team is reunited, they work together to escape the forest! 

• You are trapped in a sequence of dreams of a troubled individual, the kind of character from an Edgar Allan Poe story. You will be taken to visit the dreamer's past, present and future. Get ready to solve puzzles made from optical illusions, special visual effects and hidden imagery. Your goal is to escape from this man's subconscious!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT.  MUST PURCHASE TICKET HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/roomescape/

Is this private? Yes. Private for Meetup members & their guests.  

Can I come alone?  Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +30?  This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  About 30 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+. 

Review from Yelp - 
You will love this if you like riddles and enjoy a fun challenge. It is also a great icebreaker for someone who you have not met or getting to know deft no regrets and this will give you a sense of achievement if you are able to ESCAPE!!

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/roomescape/

results.description: Black: Color, Material, Concept presents works that explore the ways that modern and contemporary artists of African descent consider the possibilities of “black” through their choice of media, their imagery and the ideas they bring to their work. As an element of art and design, “black” can have amazingly rich gradation of tones and depths. As a word, it a single syllable that can fill columns in a dictionary. As a social construction, it is one of the most highly charged and proudly asserted realities in American life. The exhibition includes more than two dozen paintings, sculptures and prints, drawn primarily from the Studio Museum’s permanent collection. The artists represented in the exhibition range from modernist elders such as Sam Gilliam and Jack Whitten, to a mid-century generation that includes Kerry James Marshall, Glenn Ligon, Leonardo Drew, and Nari Ward, to artists who came of age in the post-Civil Rights era, such as Kara Walker, Noah Davis and Kameelah Janan Rasheed.
results.name: Exhibition

results.description:
I’m so excited to bring in the New Year with you. This is the 1st growth period for 1st New Moon in the 1st month of the new year. In short this is when we plant seeds for the upcoming year. 

I’ve run this workshop in Europe where participants have continued to refer to it as a turning point and extremely meaningful gathering in which the effects have stayed with them for months and years later. 

Schedule:
11:50 a.m. Arrival / Registration

12:00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m. 

- Welcome circle and introduction
- Intention Meditation
- Sacred Centering Yoga 
- Snack time
- Journaling 
- Somatic Dance
- Women's Circle / Seed Planting Ritual
- Soulful Discussion
- Meditation

3:00.pm. - 4 pm. (OPTIONAL)
There is a yummy, healthy cafe in the center if you’d like to grab tea or a bite to eat and connect with the community of beautiful women by your side. 

Cost:
$35 pre-registration via paypal [masked]
$45 cash in-person 

It’s Women Living Brightly’s mission to provide high-quality, low cost workshop for women from all ages and backgrounds. We work really hard to make this affordable and accessible for ALL women. PLEASE spread the word to women in your life. This is a once a year event and we have a HUGE studio!!!! Sliding scale is available for women in challenging financial situations. Contact me personally for options. 

Please Bring: 

- Journal + pencil / pen
- Cozy socks, blanket or scarf.
- Yoga mat (there are also mats at the studio)
- Easy snack to nibble partway through
- $45 cash if you have not already prepaid $35 via paypal [masked].

Practices are safe, inclusive and suitable for all ages and abilities!  

Let me know if you have any questions! Warmly,

Taryn
ww.SacredCentering.com
results.how_to_find_us: The large yoga studio on the 2nd floor. Taryn's Cell 917-717-8275.

results.description:
FUTSAL ON SUNDAY AFTERNOONS

MUST RSVP ONLINE

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time is 12pm and will run until 2:30pm. 


Gym floor, so wear flats. 1 flight upstairs from entrance door.

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING


We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 


Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

                       ~~~~@🔸☢🎱⚽️⚖⚽️🎱☢🔸@~~~~

                                  🔹🔶🔷🔵📛🔵🔷🔶🔹

FUTSAL DOMINGOS POR LA TARDE

HAY QUE RESERVAR EN LINEA

Podras reservar para jugadores multiples hasta que se llenen los cupos.

Comenzamos a las 12pm y jugamos hasta las 2:30pm


Se juega sobre piso de gimnasio asi que usen zapatos de "indoor"

No hay porteros, asi que NO SE PUEDE PORTEREAR


Se jugaran partidos de 10 minutos (ganadores siguen vivos). Habran 3 equipos de 5 jugadores (4 mas 1 cambio). El primero en anotar 3 goles gana el partido. Ganadores deberan seguir ganando para continuar vivos. Empates consecutivos se definirán por moneda.

Barridas estan Absolutamente Prohibidas

Por favor entiendan que para mantener este grupo acivo deberemos prohibir cualquier tipo de pelea o altercado. Todo aquel o aquella que pelee sera excluido (a) del grupo permanentemente. 

Eso es todo. Asi que Vamos a Jugar!   Para cualquier consulta, por favor contacteme atravez de meetup.com.
results.how_to_find_us: Corner of 37th Street and 4th Avenue in Brooklyn (use 4th Avenue entrance)

results.name: Sunday Brunch

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
DIRECTORY:

• Caribbean Islands Escape Series Index

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/events/226690445/

EVENT TYPE: Travel
COST: TBA

DIFFICULTY: Moderate
DISTANCES: 1 Miles
DURATION: 2 Hours

DESCRIPTION:
La Pointe des Châteaux (en: Castles headland) is a peninsula that extends into the Atlantic Ocean from the Eastern coast of the island of Grande-Terre, in Guadeloupe.

Located 11 km East from Saint-François (the commune it is administratively attached to), it overlooks the island of La Désirade (a dependency of Guadeloupe), eructing only 8 km away into the Atlantic.

Made of distinctive rock formations and a large littoral strip, La Pointe des Châteaux hosts rare fauna and flora species, some of which being indigenous to the site.

A dramatic place of crashing waves and strong winds, La Pointe des Châteaux stands as a popular tourist destination, attracting an average of 500,000 visitors every year.

ATTRACTIONS:
• White Sand Beaches

• Crystal Clear Waters

• Rock Formation

http://www.rike-travels-the-world.de/uploads/images/Gallery/reiseberichte/guadeloupe/Schoene%20Felseformationen%20an%20Pointe%20des%20Chateaux.JPG

• Famous Cross at Pointe des Chateaux

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/c9/Pointe_des_Chateaux_Sud.JPG

RECOMMENDED ITEMS TO BRING:
• 2x 1 Lite of bottle water
• Lunch
• Snacks & Fruits
• Sun Screen
• Bug Repellent

RECOMMENDED CLOTHES TO WEAR:
• Hat
• Sun Glasses
• Lightweight clothing
• Hiking Boots or Shoes
• Lightweight Back Pack
• Lightweight workout pants

WEATHER:
[Weather Link]

MAP:  

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Pointe+des+Ch%C3%A2teaux/@16.237785,-61.1867014,15z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x0000000000000000:0x0976359dcaf9563a


REFERENCE:

• http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g147304-d2560087-Reviews-Pointe_des_Chateaux-Saint_Francois_Grande_Terre_Island_Guadeloupe.html

• https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pointe_des_Ch%C3%A2teaux_(Guadeloupe)

You agree not to hold the meetup group's organizer, assistant organizers, event organizers, hosts, or any other group members responsible for any injuries or issues that may occur at any time before, during or after an event. You are personally responsible for obtaining essential information about an event, making necessary preparations for participating in the event, and ensuring your own safety and well-being. Your RSVP of "Yes" on the event page or attendance of an event signifies your full understanding and acceptance of the terms of this liability waiver. We reserve the rights to limit this event to physically fit people.

END

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.
results.why: It's fun and you like it...

Second-largest public park in Queens, New York. It occupies[masked] acres. The land that makes up Alley Pond Park was acquired over the course of many years between 1927 and the present. The landscape itself, however, came into existence roughly 15,000 years ago, during the Pleistocene Epoch, when a passing glacier carved out the landscape of New York City.

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Transmission Meditation with Meryl Tihanyi Alternate Sundays Beginning March 1st
1:00-3:00pm
Free Do you want to help the world and also build a stronger connection with your own spiritual nature? Transmission Meditation is a simple group meditation that provides both a dynamic service to the world and the opportunity for powerful personal spiritual development. *It is a group meditation based on the Science of Triangles, that makes possible the scientific distribution or transmission of highly potent spiritual energies into the world.
*It is the creation, in conscious co-operation with the Masters of Wisdom, of a vortex or pool of higher energy for the benefit of humanity.
*It is a combination of two yogas: Karma yoga (the yoga of service) and Laya yoga (the yoga of energy or chakras).
*Introduced to the world in 1974 by artist and author Benjamin Creme, there are now hundreds of Transmission Meditation groups active in many countries around the world.
*It is safe, and will enhance and complement any other spiritual practice or service activity in which you may already be engaged. Come to a FREE introduction to Transmission Meditation, followed by a group meditation.
results.name: Transmission Meditation with Meryl Tihanyi

results.description:
At our workshop learn and practice the magical art of Ebru using all provided materials, paint, and original ecru marbling supplies. Get inspired and energized by the relaxing atmosphere of a creative space. Enjoy the story of Ebru and the live demonstration by artist and graphic designer, Kate Goltseva.

This workshop is part of our bigger art event, "Show Your World": create your own world with the Ebru technique!

Those participants who want to practice with the instructor and CREATE THEIR OWN pieces of art should register for a paid attendance, as we have a limited 5-people workplace and art supplies. Fee: $40.00 - as a result of the workshop, take home an amazing piece of art made by yourself. The workshop if free for those who want to enjoy the demonstration, music, and wine. 

Book your spot, if you're going to create your own artwork: http://www.reartiste.com/art-terrace/

About the instructor, Kate Goltseva:
Kate Goltseva is an interdisciplinary artist who is exploring feelings, human behavior, and expression. Kate's art is about raw materials and emotions we are made of: love, longing, compassion, hesitation... It is about an endless journey of the Soul, struggling for peace inside. More info: www.reartiste.com
results.name: The Ebru Workshop

For those of you who who use a smart phone I have to put the link for registration up front here. It's at


https://www.romemu.org/events/experience-your-souls-energy-through-singing

Together we will be have a lot of fun and create a safe and sacred space to experience new, deeper and more sincere freedom of expression. After learning to express instinctively with your voice you will bring your intention higher and align with your whole being. As a pure vessel of energy and expression you will become a vibrating instrument both receiving and giving from a greater place in your consciousness.

You will start by freeing your body from the inside out as you learn to train your breath support with special diaphragm training. You will then do 2 exercises. The first one will bring in ancient power of language articulation. The second one will bring in divine energy, (from Rudolf Steiner's work with the voice). At the end of the workshop, you will be led to experience a deeper and more personal integration. Some students will be selected from the group to receive individual coaching. If you want to receive individual coaching, bring a song, monologue, or speech. This workshop will be registered through and held at Romemu...

Please register and pay at this link...

results.description:
Deepen your connection to self and invite peace and happiness...


All are welcome to this healing circle of Reiki, meditation and pranayama (breathing).  New to Reiki, Pranayama or meditation?  Join us!  Interested in Reiki, Pranayama or meditation? Join us!  Already familiar with Reiki, Pranayama or meditation? Join us!  Reiki practitioner? Join us!  All are welcome! Come join this monthly Reiki, Meditation and Pranayama (Yogic breathing) Healing Circle and get reconnected with self and happiness.  This hour long healing circle will help you center, balance and invite deep peace into your life, while giving you tools to practice at home and on your own, until we meet again the following month.

The healing circle will begin with Reiki, followed by guided Pranayama (yogic breathing techniques that you will learn in the healing circle and can practice at home on your own until the next healing circle), followed by a Yoga centered guided meditation (centered around the Chakras, Dharma, Kharma, Ananda, transformation, finding balance, serenity, happiness, understanding your life's purpose and more) while you receive Reiki from an experienced Reiki Master, followed by more Reiki and Reiki sharing. This healing circle is for all who are interested in Reiki and meditation and is open to anyone who is interested in both giving and receiving Reiki.  All lineages are welcome.  There will be time for discussion and sharing.  No experience necessary.  Please dress comfortably and bring a yoga mat if you have one.  (Option to sit in a chair as well).  If you have a current yoga class package with Amanda you can use it towards this circle (just bring $5).  No yoga class package? results.description:
From the Apollo Theater: 

WNYC returns to the historic Apollo Theater for its 10th annual Martin Luther King Jr. Day celebration. Presented as part of the Apollo Uptown Hall series, this year's event focuses on disparity in America by looking at the impact of institutional racism while exploring race and privilege. Co-hosts Brian Lehrer and Jami Floyd lead an honest and authentic conversation that recognizes racism as a national, systemic, institutional crisis.

Special performances by Daniel Bernard Roumain with Special Guests Marc Bamuthi Joseph and Emeline Michel.

Our Meetup

We'll meetup at Aloft Hotel first (2296 Frederick Douglass Boulevard, 8th Ave. btwn 123rd & 124th Streets) for a quick meet & greet at the bar area at 1:30pm, then head over to the Apollo Theater at 1:45pm to go in as a group.

<a>If you RSVP to attend, please do not be late!</a>

<a>We will be entering as a group via a VIP entrance - once we are in, we're in and there will not be anyone to allow you in with the group. If you arrive after the group has entered the Apollo, you'll need to enter via the general public entry.</a>

The panel discussion starts at 3pm - try not to arrive later than 2:30pm to get the best seats!

Directions to the Apollo Theater

- Take the A, B, C or D trains to 125th Street and walk 1.25 blocks East to the Apollo Theater.

- Take the 2 or 3 trains to 125th Street and walk 1.75 blocks West to the Apollo Theater.

- Nearby public bus stops are the M2, M3, M10, M60, M101, M104, and BX15

For those that are driving, there are several parking options in the area. If you're running late, need further directions, or have any questions, feel free to call or text Daniel at [masked] for more information.

About the Apollo Theater

The Apollo Theater, established in 1913, is located at 253 West 125th Street in the Harlem and has long played a central role in Harlem’s, and America's, entertainment culture. This 1,500 seat theater has launched the careers of many notable African-American artists with it's Amateur Night program (which started in 1934 and still runs today) and hosted performances of many world-renowned artists. With an almost endless who's-who list of the artists who have performed on it's stage through the years and today, the Apollo Theater is clearly one of the most famous theaters in America, around the world, and a staple in Harlem.
results.how_to_find_us: Meetup at Aloft Hotel first (2296 Frederick Douglass Boulevard, btwn 123rd & 124th Streets) then head to the Apollo Theater
results.name: Apollo Uptown Hall: Exploring MLK’s Two Americas - Free VIP Admission w/ Group

****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

Program (Live Event)

Date: Sunday, Jan. 17, 2016

Location: CAP 21 Studios, 18 West 18th St., (Between 5th Ave. & 6th Ave., South Side of Street), elevator to the 5th Floor, Room 505, NYC

Time: 2pm – 4pm,Please arrive in the lobby 10 minutes before the 2pm meeting begins. Ask the Welcome Desk person for “Nick Curto's room assignment” if you need help in finding the room. Please be on time, as late arrivals may disrupt the meeting.

Topic: “THE WYRD OF SCOTLAND”

Featured Guest Speaker: TEEL JAMES GLENN

Program: Since time immemorial the Highlands of Scotland have sheltered mystery and magic, from the Historic cannibal clan of Sawney Beane and Macbeth’s encounters with witches to Fairies, Brownies, Bogles, Kelpies, Mermaids and the famous Nessie to the contemporary Falkirk Triangle’ with sightings around The Loch Lomond of Scottish UFOs. The Falkirk triangle stretches from Stirling to the outskirts of Edinburgh and is said to be home to upwards of 300 sighting each year. The famous sighting at Bonnybridge a small town, just outside of Falkirk, has had so many UFO sightings it is now officially twinned with Roswell in New Mexico, the site of the famous alleged saucer crash in 1947.

Winner of the 2012 Pulp Ark 'Best Author of the Year.' Epic ebook award finalist. results.description:
This month's Meetup will be co-facilitated by Martha E. Miller, LCSW (Licensed Clinical Social Worker). 


"To Everything There is a Season”

Learning from the Winter Season - Resting into your Resources

Winter presents an interesting dilemma for many of us - we wish to start off the new year with a bang, setting in motion all those new year’s resolutions, and yet with the cold weather and the short days, everything in us screams “hit the snooze button, stay under the covers and forget about Zumba!‘   And while we don’t want to abandon all of our resolutions,  paying closer attention to nature, and the innate wisdom of the ever changing seasons can offer us wonderful instruction on how to trust the processes of change and growth - in due time.  According to the Five Elements philosophy in Chinese medicine,  winter is a time to replenish our energy, to reflect, and to allow new life to gestate in the invisible, inner terrain.  Based on past retreats I’ve led on living in harmony with the seasons,  this talk will offer insights and practices from eastern and western psychologies on how one can live in harmony with the tasks of winter, rather than fighting them.  Techniques for quieting our overtaxed ‘fight or flight’ stress response and soothing our weary mind and emotions will be introduced. 

Martha E. Miller, LCSW (Licensed Clinical Social Worker)

Martha is an integrative psychotherapist in private practice in NYC.  After 25 years in the field, Martha is particularly excited these days about helping people build greater resilience to stress through the practice of mind-body strategies that provide rest and healing for the body, while cultivating mental and emotional states in which creative solutions can emerge.  As an enthusiast of Flow and the creative process, Martha is also a practicing composer and songwriter.  For more info, www.marthaemiller.com

results.name: "To Everything There Is A Season" - Presentation by Martha Miller

RACE AND PRIVILEGE: EXPLORING MLK'S TWO AMERICAS

IN COLLABORATION WITH MARCH ON WASHINGTON FILM FESTIVAL

WNYC returns to the historic Apollo Theater for its 10th annual Martin Luther King Jr. Day celebration. Presented as part of the Apollo Uptown Hall series, this year's event focuses on disparity in America by looking at the impact of institutional racism while exploring race and privilege. Co-hosts Brian Lehrer and Jami Floyd lead an honest and authentic conversation that recognizes racism as a national, systemic, institutional crisis.

results.description:
Come and get up close and personal to see wolves in action! Once you are at the preserve you will be invited into the observation area in the center of the preserve. You will be surrounded by 4 different packs of wolves. 90 minute tour, $15 cash only Wolf Watch
Wolf Watch tours are led by owner Jim Stein and Becky Mace, who have raised and care for all the animals at the preserve. During their presentations you will learn about the social structure of wolf packs, their eating habits, their interaction with man, and many other interesting facts. We will try to educate you about the true behavior of the wolf and will be glad to answer any questions you may have. While in the observation area you will be able to watch the wolves play, interact with each other and maybe even hear them howl! Truly an experience of a lifetime. You will also get to see and learn about our fox and bobcats that live at the preserve. Yes you can take photos on the wolf watch tour.
results.name: Lakota Wolf Preserve

results.description:
Have you ever tried painting on stones? Try with us! 

Bring your favorite pebble and acrylic, sip wine, and learn the unique technique of painting on stones from the master, Shirley Siegal.

A renowned artist from Israel, Shirley Siegal, is a painter and educator. She is also a Finalist of the international art competition, "Show Your World".
To make art, Shirley Siegal uses various media including oil on canvas or board, watercolor, acrylic on stone, charcoal, sepia and pencils.

At a result of this workshop, take home your own unique artwork on a stone!

Shirley Siegal will present a technique of stone painting and teach you how to do it. She is a professional lecturer and a very inspired, spiritual artist. If you want to give it a try, bring the pebble/stone you like, the paint, and your favorite brush.

If you want to take this class seriously, below is the full list of possible materials you can bring. The fee to take this masterclass: $20.00 - covers wine, beverages.

All possible materials to work with:

The stones should have a smooth surface, river-bed stones. They should be white and not have any lacquer or varnish on them.
They can be collected anywhere, or you can purchase a bag in a gardening nursery, where they sell gardening equipment. We will use acrylic paint. The more shades, the better. Materials and tools: · A pencil, eraser and pencil sharpener
· Sketching paper for planning the final drawing
· Black permanent (water resistant) pen, size S, or F, and M (medium).
· Acrylic paints, The more shades, the better: blue, light blue, cyan…
red, magenta, pink…
yellow, ochre
purple,
dark green, light green,
brown,
flesh tone,
white,
black · Flat watercolor brushes no. 2, 4, 6, 8
· Round brushes, pointed tip, no.0 , 00 , 000 (for very fine details)
· Artist palette
· Water can
· Paper towels
· River-bed rock (pebble) made of limestone or other smooth surface that was cleaned with soapy warm water, 20 cm or 8'' in length.

results.name: Painting on the Rocks! :-)

results.description:
As the organizer for Becoming Limitless, my primary objective is to give YOU ACCESS to CREATING a LIFE Beyond Your Wildest Dreams!


If you are the type of person who wants to be capable of creating ANYTHING that you want in your life... from the relationship of your dreams, to the job of your dreams, to the family life of your dreams or virtually anything else... you want to be at this introduction!

At this introduction you will be getting a taste of what is covered in the extraordinary 3 and a half day personal-development seminar that is The Landmark Forum. 

You will have the opportunity toparticipate in a breakthrough Possibility Exercise. (So bring an area of life you want to work on!! ;)

And you will have the opportunity to register for the Landmark Forum! The introduction is completely FREE and will be valuable to you regardless whether you choose to do the full program or not! The full program costs $665 in NYC and is by far THE best valued self-development program which I have ever participated in thus far! (Bring your calendars!)

This is where I realized that a life beyond your wildest dreams IS POSSIBLE!

Would love to see you there and as always you're welcome to bring your friends as well!

- Mike Guerrieri


www.StyleCoachNYC.com

Disclaimer: I don't gain any kind of financial benefit if you come to this introduction or register for any of their programs. The benefit I get is that I see you living a life closer to the life of your dreams, and THAT's what gets me going!! ;)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ow7JjaVa3bU

This is a Blues Rock Jam Ensemble.

We will have charts and specific guitar parts as well as lots of room to jam and develop solo technique.

We'll play Cream, Zeppelin, B.B.King, Hendrix and more classics of rock and blues.

Acoustic, electric guitars and bass welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


Vocals welcome!

This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (check by 12/30)

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

Every Sunday 3-5pm starting January 10th til April 17th, a week before the performance, 15 practice sessions.

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (15 sessions at discount + $30 show fee) for $365  (you save $40 on practice sessions)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2VLVLRLATSNKU


Show Day is Sunday, May 1st at 3pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village April 24th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( 

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

Let's jam those tunes!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge

results.description:
On Sunday, January 17, we are having our Annual Winter "Board Game Night" at a private home. (The snow date is Sunday, January 31.) Please arrive any time after 3 PM for snacks and beverages. The games will begin at approximately 3:45.

This year, we will enjoy an Italian Holiday Smorgasbord for supper ! Served buffet-style, entrees will include both meat and vegetarian dishes. As usual, we will have an assortment of appetizers, soft and alcoholic beverages, plenty of desserts and coffee, tea and hot chocolate. We will begin playing 3 different games, such as Taboo, Trivia, Pictionary, Scrabble, Balderdash, Guesstures and Go Mental. You will have the opportunity to play the same game all evening, or rotate and try different games. We rotate approximately every 45 minutes. Supper will be served around 7 PM. An "0pen Bar" of wine, beer, a variety of alcoholic drinks, water, seltzer, club soda and snacks will be available all evening.

The cost for this event, which will bring together about 50 age-appropriate upscale singles, is $ 25. per person if paid in advance, or $ 35. paid at the door. All food and beverages are included in the admission price.
To pre-pay for this event, please mail your check, payable to Jerry D., to Post Office Box 443, Midland Park, NJ 07432. As space is limited to 50 people, please mail your check by Sunday, January 10.

The exact address will be emailed to the "Yes" RSVPs by Friday, January 15.

results.description:
Sometimes it's helpful to write in a group. So in this meeting we're coming together to just write. No critiques, no audiences (unless you want one), no pressure but that which you put on yourself.  Here's how it works:

Part 1:

3:00- 3:45 we will write from a prompt provided by the organizer or one of the attending members.

Part 2:

3:50 - 5:50 is dedicated time for free writing. Work on whatever you want.  We'd hope that work generated during these sessions will be submitted to any of the other Meetups or for broadcast on our podcast, Kaleidocast.

Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!

results.description:
For members working on writing projects at home who are looking for some feedback - this is the meetup for you. Please post one piece you wish to have critiqued to the Files section of the meetup page by midnight of the Thursday immediately preceding this meetup (giving members enough time to read it!).
Requirement to attend this meeting: read through and critique all recent files (http://www.meetup.com/StatenIsland-Writers/files/) posted by members who have RSVPed "Yes" to this meetup and be prepared to DISCUSS your thoughts (remember we are looking for more than "it was good" - constructive criticism is our bread and butter!). Many members find it helpful to bring notes to share with the writer either written on a printed out copy of the work, or on a separate sheet of paper.

Note:
For all of our meetups at public establishments it is essential that we show our gratitude for the venue that has agreed to host our meetings by being patrons as we enjoy their space. While there is no fee to attend this meetup, please come prepared to purchase something (even if it is something as small as a bottle of water) from the cafe.
results.name: Critique and Discussion of Personal Projects

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 3:30-5:30pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Chers membres,

For lovers of Renaissance and Baroque French music, I am scheduling this very special concert which will take place on

JANUARY 17, 2016 from 5:00- 7:00 pm in Manhattan.

Our Meetup group is getting a special discount for premium seats at $20 a ticket (instead of $30) + a processing fee of $1.70 - total $21.70 per person for a group of at least 10 people.

Sign up and send me a check made out to cash.  Your payment of $21.70 per person must be arriving at my address by January 15 LATEST!  When signing up, you will be able to see my address.

                                            Anne de Bretagne

New Vintage Baroque ushers in the new year with The Body Untied. This program features a new commission by the Breton composer Simon Frisch, a song cycle exploring the legacy of historic French queen (twice over) Anne of Brittany (1477 - 1514). As the last duchess of an independent Brittany, and a ferocious diplomat and patron of the arts, she surpassed her circumstances to live a life of enormous consequence for Europe. The cycle traces the arc of Anne's coercion into the French crown and legendary forty-day funeral, and ruminates on her embodiment, even centuries later, of the resilient spirit of the Breton. The texts, infused with chilling winds, sea salt, flora, violence, and mourning, are drawn from her court, funeral rites, and contemporary Anglo-Breton poet Claire Trévien. Interspersed are dances and Baroque court music of Couperin and Lully, guided with narration of Anne's life and influence. There will also be a fabulous motet by Anne's court composer Jean Mouton.


The church will be illuminated with projections by artist Rachel Libeskind


There are several French texts (14th/15th) set to music in the program, as well as the eloquent titles for the baroque composer Couperin's suite Apothéose de Lully. there is Renaissance music from her court as well: a processional to launch the event, and a motet written for Anne's funeral.

the narration itself will be in English (for audience accessibility).

Video New Vintage Baroque - interview and music       https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rN4thgyG3Oc&feature=youtu.be

Eolo- Seasonal Sicilian Kitchen
190 7th Avenue (@21st Street)
Sunday, January 17th
5:00 optional drinks, 6:00 dinner
$77 3- course, glass wine, tax /tip 

Note: You must RSVP and prepay online at www.thesinglegourmet.net/event/eolo/
all of our events have 20-40 members and everyone must prepay in advance for table assignments and proper headcount. RSVP on here is nice, but until it is paid you will not be considered on the RSVP list. Award winning chef/owner Melissa Muller Daka, opened Eolo (God who rules the wind) in 2010 as a “love letter to Sicily”, where she spent summers working in her grandmother’s restaurant. A graduate of the French Culinary Institute, Columbia University’s Culinary Anthropology program, a James Beard House Invited Chef and voted by her peers as a Best Chef in America (less than 1% of chefs win this award), Melissa’s love and devotion towards her Italian roots shines in her 23 rated Zagat restaurant. At Eolo, food is thought to be a source of great pleasure as well as an insight into the culture of Sicily. In a warm and relaxed setting, Eolo serves Sicilian-inspired contemporary fare in a comfortable setting with on-point staff, whose deep-rooted Italian manager happens to be a close friend. The menu will not be the traditional Italian we are accustomed to, but more Sicilian home-style with interesting dishes that will be new to your palate.

TNYA Water Polo is an LGBTQ friendly team with practices at John Jay College Sunday from 6:00 – 7:30 pm, and Tuesday 8:00 or 9:00 - 10:00 pm at the Chelsea Rec Center (for Rec Center  members only). For full information on the team, please go to <a href="http://www.tnya.org/">www.tnya.org

The first practice is free and we love getting new players! Please let the coach on deck know if it's your first time with us and feel free to message Alex Barclay ahead of time if you have any questions. You will need to bring a swim suit appropriate for water polo, a towel, goggles and a lock. If you would like to practice with us regularly, you must become registered with US Water Polo at the silver level and pay our annual membership dues. 

We ask that any practice participants have some prior experience playing water polo and be able to swim a hundred yards in a row in less than two minutes. If you have a swimming background and are interested in learning water polo, please read the pdf below thoroughly and contact Alex Barclay. The coaching is typically geared to an intermediate level of play and we do work on basic skills at every practice. Everyone should be familiar with the basic rules and concepts of the game, as outlined in this pdf:

http://www.tnya.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Polo_Beginners.pdf

Practices typically include a swim set and some conditioning at the beginning, drills, and scrimmaging for the last 30-45 minutes (it's also ok to sit out for the scrimmaging portion if it's your first practice). Bob or Jeff are the typical coaches. We strive to create a positive and welcoming environment and do not tolerate any unsportsmanlike conduct. There are at least four tournaments we compete in each year and practices will adjust in the weeks before the tournaments to prepare participating players.

This month we will be going to Turkish Kitchen, an excellent place in east Midtown.  A menu is here.  They have several entrees for $16-18, but if you want to splurge they have some for more like $25, and many appetizers.  The wine list is huge, and a Turkish beer can be had for $7.

People are to pay a $5 deposit to RSVP via Paypal or credit card, which will be refunded in cash at 6:10pm, 10 minutes after the event starts.  No-shows and latecomers will forfeit their deposit.  Deposits will be refunded electronically for cancellations more than 24 hours in advance.  Please don't show up without RSVP'ing.

An article in Psychology Today indicates that research shows that, in the US, political liberals tend to have significantly higher IQ's than political conservatives.  OK, that settles it, right?  That means that all conservatives are wrong about everything and should change their minds, right?  But this other article, from Reason Magazine, shows that the previous research forgot to cover Libertarians, who turn out to be smarter than political liberals.


The book "Outliers", much of which is about differences in performance between different cultures, talks a lot about how Asian cultures stress effort over intrinsic intelligence.  Where an American white, if they are bad at something, will conclude "I suck at this" and stop trying, an Asian kid is told that they aren't trying hard enough.  I've read elsewhere that if you look at the frequency with which Asians become doctors, lawyers, and professionals in the US, you would conclude that their IQ is 14 points higher than it is.  This article in Scientific American says nothing about ethnic groups or nationalities, but stresses the same difference in raising kids.


This article, titled "The Future of Life Depends on Bringing the 500-Year Rampage of the White Man to a Halt", is a brazenly sexist and racist piece by Alternet.  If this "rampage" needs to be brought to a "halt", then it is still going on.  But the article talks mostly about the sins of the past, describing nothing that is currently happening.  Furthermore, it makes questionable assertions, such as that American slavery was worse than anywhere else, which is absurd: Turks and Chinese, for example, often castrated their slaves, which was generally not the custom in the US.

results.description:
Abyssinia Restaurant is the Ethiopian restaurant in Manhattan.

This is communal dining at it's best. We won't be breaking bread - we'll be tearing it and using the bread for scooping up the delectable stews and salads. This food is delicious, light and extraordinary.

What about the lack of utensils? YOU have utensils - the best possible - your fingers. The injera is made from teff flour, the smallest grain out there. It's super nutritious and protein packed. Let's let Wikipedia do what they do best: "In making injera, teff flour is mixed with water and allowed to ferment for several days, as with sourdough starter. As a result of this process, injera has a mildly sour taste. The injera is then ready to be baked into large, flat pancakes. This is done either on a specialized electric stove or, more commonly, on a clay plate (Amharic mittad, Tigrinya mogogo) placed over a fire. Unusual for a yeast or sourdough bread, the dough has sufficient liquidity to be poured onto the baking surface, rather than rolled out. In terms of shape, injera compares to the French crêpe and the Indian dosa as a flatbread cooked in a circle and used as a base for other foods. The taste and texture, however, are unlike the crêpe and dosa, and more similar to the South Indian appam. The bottom surface of the injera, which touches the heating surface, will have a relatively smooth texture, while the top will become porous. This porous structure allows the injera to be a good bread to scoop up sauces and dishes."

Ok, enough! Let's eat.

http://www.harlemethiopianfood.com


Our Plan:


Meet at Abyssinia Restaurant at 6pm.

Accessibility:

The restaurant is accessible.

Consult mta.info TripPlanner for accessible options to the restaurant. Closest elevator station is at 125th Street.

Subway: 2, 3, C, B, to 135th St

Bus: M2, M3, M10, BX33

results.description:
Last Call: Please confirm your reservation for Huertas with your $82 payment via PayPal to [masked]. Thank you!


To get a glimpse of why Basque cuisine is all the rage, please join us at Huertas on Sunday, January 17, with chef Jonah Miller, a 2015 James Beard Rising Star Chef of the Year semifinalist. On the menu are three versions of the signature Basque pintxos—small, “composed” bites (unlike tapas, these are not meant to be shared) paired with Spanish wine or sherry-based aperitif-style drinks; a selection of “conservas” and roasted octopus paired with Txakoli; and heartier “raciones” (shared plates) paired with Spanish red wine. I’m told that dessert will likely be house-made churros and chocolate!
results.name: Dinner & Refrescos Pairing at Huertas

results.description:
Dinner and Dancing!

Save January 17th for our dinner and dance at Biagio's!
- hosted by Simply Social Dancing. 


No partner needed to attend.  Although couples are welcome!  This event is open to the public.

This is a good event if you want to meet people, enjoy good food, and learn some partner dancing.


...
Sunday, January 17th
Time: 6:00 to 9:00 pm
$35.00 buffet style dinner (includes tip) / Cash bar    
...

Please call Biagio's directly to reserve tickets. [masked]
Why reserve?
They give us more food entrees if more people commit.
They give us a bartender in the room, if we have over 40 people commit.
If no one calls ahead, they are forced to prepare the minimum.
PLEASE CALL!!

...
Biagio's Restaurant
299 Paramus Rd, Paramus, NJ, US
http://www.biagios.com
We will be in their upstairs Banquet room, in the restaurant.
Plenty of parking. 
...
Music: a variety of music provided for a variety of partner dances.


Starts with a Dance Lesson  (about 40 min. lesson)
The lesson is for beginners, so they can join in the dancing.
It is also a chance to break the ice and meet people.

Suggested attire: No need to wear suit & tie.  
However, this is a classy joint, so your worn comfy jeans would not be suggested.


Upcoming dates for your event calendar:

January 17th

March 20th

June 19th

August 21st

October 16th

Questions & concerns: 


Lisa[masked]  
www.simplysocialdancing.com

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

You can meet the group on the steps to the church following mass and walk over together or you can meet the group at the bar.  It is easy to find us.

Grab a seat at the bar or you can sit at a table to eat and drink.

Pay as you go for food and drink. A full menu is available

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last?

Usually around 9ish
results.name: After Mass Gathering at Blossom

results.description:
TRANSFORMATIONAL POETRY and Short Stories

“The birds have vanished into the sky,

  and the last clouds  have drained away.

 We sit together, the Mountain and me,

 Until only the Mountain remains.”  Li Po  701_762 AD  (Chinese Poet)

We will read and discuss various Transformational Poems that Resonate and bring us to “Wonder, Mystery and Oneness”.  Among the poets we will explore are: Mary Oliver, Rumi, Ryokan, Li Po, Rilke, Basho, Antonia Machado, Hafiz, Lao Tzu, Chuang Tzu and many others. 

No previous experience is necessary.  If you have favorite poems and/or short stories, please bring their work with you to share. You could even bring your own poem, the more poems we have the richer the experience will be. 

TIMES 7:00 to 8:30 pm starting Sunday Jan 17th. You can come to any session, they are not consecutive. We will start at 7:00 pm sharp, so please come at least by 6:45.

PLACE: All Souls Unitarian Church 80th Street and Lexington Avenue.

BRING:  Please bring PAPER and PENCIL

FREE: A small donation ($1 to $5) would be appreciated for the Room and Clean-Up
