results.description:
Welcome to NYC LGBT Craft Beer Meetup's FIRST meetup!!! Most of these will be held on Sundays, unless all you fine lovely craft beer nerds wanna do a different day :)

This first meetup will feature and be sponsored by Troegs Brewery! Generously reserving a keg of Mad Elf for us, we will be tapping it along side other limited seasonal releases. $5 Pints for our group, a chance to get together and talk craft beer, plus snacks on the house! The more people we get, the more rare beer we can get our hands on, so share this meetup with your friends and join us on January 17th @ 7pm! Also, we will be setting up a coat donation bin for those in need this winter! so if you have any extra coats laying around, bring 'em!

results.description:
Things are heated up at the "Hop". Great dance music from the 50's and 60's. Rock and Roll - Motown - R&B - Doo Wop - etc. 7:pm until 11:30.  at the Iguana Café.  The admission is $15. which includes $5. off house liquor, or beer / wine, or food, or two free sodas. Come on out and stimulate your "young at heart" nature.  Even if you are not an avid dancer, you will certainly enjoy listening to the music and watching us old folks dance. Don't stay at home on a Sunday evening..... Join me: .....look for the lady with the curly, curly hair and an orange head band with ribbons and a  flower (or hair flower). I will keep looking for you at the tables near the DJ.  If I am off dancing I will always return to the tables by the D J section of the room.

 ; Come on out and join the fun at "Sock Hop Sundays".  The socialization, and the music are worth the effort.

results.description:
"Tuning the mind, body, and soul"-Gaynor

The sound and silence meditation group meets every Sunday. The meditation begins with 30 min. of  toning*, 30 minutes of silent meditation, In the last 10 min. there is time for a brief discussion, questions, or sharing.


According to Gaynor (1999, p. [masked]), "Sounds enters the healing equation from several different directions: It may alter cellular functions through energetic effects; it may entrain biological systems to function more homeostatically; it may becalm the mind and therefore the body; or it may have emotional effects, which influence neurotransmitters and neuropeptides, which in turn help regulate the immune system-the healer within. Music is organized sound that has potent emotional effects and stimulates memories, associations, and highly developed  psychological states with clear impact on our healing systems."

 Toning* in your own voice is a very powerful tool for self-healing, relaxation, personal growth, opening creativity, and helping to balance life experiences.Toning is the elongation of a note or tone using breath and voice to assist you to get still enough to meditate.
It is great.....
• If you have a difficult time getting still enough to meditate;
• If you desire higher states of consciousness;
• If your communication energy center seems blocked;
• If you breathe too shallowly;
• If you need immediate grief or stress relief;
• If you're depressed;
• If you need more confidence or zest;
• If you have trouble listening, focusing or being in the moment

We look forward to seeing you at the next scheduled meet-up!Please e-mail me at [masked] if you have any questions or concerns.
results.name: Sound and Silence Meditation

results.description:
Sunday Evening at Heights Meditation is a great way to either end your week or begin your week (or both!) with others similarly-minded, those seeking clarity of mind and open-heartedness in their everyday lives.

The Sunday evening meeting normally begins with some chant as a means to center the self and lighten up. We like to think of it as a kind of spiritual singalong, and who doesn't like a singalong? We use several easy-to-learn and different Sanskrit texts and leave it to members to choose a chant they'd like the group to use on a particular evening. If you have never chanted before, come along and try out this wonderful spiritual tool. It doesn't matter if it seems strange to you--the point is precisely to buck oneself out of a sense of 'ordinary' life--or if you think you are completely atonal. You will probably derive a lot of benefit from doing chant, and it can lastingly help you forward in life.

After the chanting ends, we immediately go into silent meditation for 20-25 minutes. Whereas chant tends to focus and energize the body and mind, silent meditation tends to quiet and calm the mind. It's a perfect counterpoint to the chanting.

As you can see, then, the Sunday evening meetings are a kind of dual spiritual exercise: of energizing and focusing the mind (chant) and then relaxing and calming it (meditation).

Come along to this or our other meetings if you feel you'd like to live a happier, calmer life and be able to live fearlessly through the cares and worries of modern life. If you can find a way to slow down and live more mindfully, you are well on the way to being an agent of joy and serenity in your own life and the lives of those living around you.
results.how_to_find_us: A or 1 Trains to 190th Street, south entrance to the church. Look for signs posted on the doors!
results.name: Meditate Together Sunday Evenings

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.
results.how_to_find_us: Next to the Chase Bank; next to the sound garden. One flight walk up to 2nd Floor. Parking on street or in parking lot behing the buiding. No meters on Sunday.

Fulfill your new year's resolution of meeting new people by joining us at our 9th annual Winter Singles Bash!  This is a multi-Meetup event at one of NYC's most exclusive lounges.

We'll have up to 300 professional, upscale singles in their 20s, 30s, & 40s attending!  Plus, no work Monday!!

1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "15" at checkout - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Jan-17-2016_at_0730PM

• Complimentary Appetizers 

 2 For 1 Drinks (7:30-8:30pm)

• DJ & Dancing

• Ice Breakers

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Up to 300 singles (20s, 30s, 40s) 

1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "15" at checkout - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Jan-17-2016_at_0730PM

$20 after that online w/ RSVP, $30 at the door 

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur.

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non ethnic specific. General age range 20s-40s.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have up to 300 members attending. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Jan-17-2016_at_0730PM
results.how_to_find_us: Party is private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
Fun time last night, what a meetup im glad everyone had a great time and best of all meet new people and laugh with, were going to continue these meetups as long as the club keeps giving us free tickets. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Tracy Morgan, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Host: Jonathan Randall, Mark Normand (Conan, Last Comic Standing), Gina Brillon (Comedy Central), Kyle Grooms (Comedy Central), Greer Barnes (HBO), Ryan Reiss (Conan), Yannis Pappas (Comedy Central) and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander. Last few meetups Jay Pharaoh From SNL dropped by I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.
results.name: Comedy Central Meetup at Stand Up New York Free, 2 drink min, Yannis Pappas

group.name: Alternative to the Bar Fun Things To Do In NYC Today!

results.description:
5v5 indoor gym soccer

With a smaller field and fewer players on a team, the quick-paced indoor soccer game helps players keep in shape and sharpen skills during the cold winter months. 

Why play with us:

Teammates are highly supportive & everyone gets involved in play.Play is at a good level, but not too competitive. No rough playing is ever tolerated.It's a friendly & diverse group. Meet new people and make new friends.   Share a laugh, conversation, and talk about your favorite soccer player. It's a fun workout indoors. We sometimes go out after our games.

Play according to your own schedule! Frequency of games make it simple. Unlike soccer leagues, there is no commitment for a season.
results.name: Indoor gym soccer-Fleetwood

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
PlayMusician Presents:   Sunday Nite - Music Roundup

Sunday Jan 17

Monday being a Holiday (Martin Luther King Day), come hang out and get some of the best Music Jersey City has to offer at Jersey City's top notch Club room @Transmission.

Live Performances by -  starting 8pm

DAve Borkman (Bowie Tributes), The bombastic band BY DESIGN, JC's favorite duo The Sensational Country Blues Wonders and the Boys from Hoboken - F-66

Open Jam is between 11pm and 11:30pm. Hit us up if you wanna jam and play. Choose a key / song and play - Improvisation galore.  Email us [masked].

The DJ AFTER PARTY is gonna be frickin' awesome with DJ SOL DEEP.  SUNDAY NITE PARTY - CAUSE MONDAY IS A AN AWESOME HOLIDAY . BEST ~ PM KREW>

===============================================================

PLAYMUSICIAN

--------------------
PlayMusician provides a platform for artists, both upcoming and established, to showcase their talent, ranging from singer /songwriters , solo artists, spoken word/poetry and full bands. We provide a comfortable, laid back venue with the intention of being a place where people can come together and enjoy local artists, and eventually becoming a staple in the community. We help local businesses such as bars/restaurants become music venues . Playmusician has been an artist bedrock since 2010.

PM JAM NITES (Open Mic)

-----------------------------------
This is an event of the month to attract local talent and create an artistically social event. Artists sign up to perform and are delegated a slot to perform . Designated Artists are featured and showcased along with the open jam/mic performances.
The Open Mic event begins at 9:00pm.
PM JAM NITES (The Artist Showcase & DJ After Party)
-------------------------------------------------------------------
The Artist Showcase & DJ After Party is an event where music and arts are performed by seasoned musicians/ artists in a live music environment including bands, spoken word, singer /songwriters, comics, painters and dancers

The Artist Showcase is followed by a Dj After-party @ 12:00 am to end the nite dancing with a DJ/emcee.


Description
-----------------

Playmusician hosts PM JAM NITES which are events for open mics and artist showcases held at a local venue.

We provide a comfortable, laid back venue with the intention of being a place where people can come together and enjoy local artists, and eventually becoming a staple in the community.

We help local businesses such as bars/restaurants become music venues . Playmusician has been an artist bedrock since 2010.

General Information

------------------------------

PlayMusician is a group that promotes local artists and musicians by creating musical events with eclectic themes and showcasing them.

Seasoned artists have been matched with young up and coming musicians that want to learn, all focused on creating a set list of music based on a theme.  We also try to promote any other types of artists such as photographers, videographers, henna artists, painters, comedians, dancers, etc. An artist’s passion is what we hope to support and encourage.

It’s a community that we hope to grow through our events, website, social media and personal networking.

results.description:
Watch the debates with us!

Theater in Asylum, with the NYC chapter of the Democratic Socialists of America, is preparing to create theatrical adaptations of the Democratic Primary Debates. With a small army of actors, designers, dramaturgs, and support staff, we will watch and analyze the debates, devise a piece, and present it live in NYC. There might be multiple Hillarys, a female Bernie, a Greek chorus of "questions from Facebook"--anything to illustrate and illuminate the candidates. First theater performance is in February, but join us for the first step in making it: a Watch Party!

Debate starts at 9pm but please arrive early! And tip your bartender!!

Learn more about the theater project: http://www.theaterinasylum.com/debates.html
results.name: Fourth Democratic Primary Debate Watch Party

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization that meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

THIS EVENT IS FOR MEAL DISTRIBUTION: Volunteers gather on East 11th street for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers distributing food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT:
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday night and would be thrilled to extend up to 8 distribution spots to NYC Volunteer Opportunities members each week. TO JOIN: RSVP here or feel free to check out 10,000 PB&Js group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs
results.name: Volunteer with 10,000 PB&Js

results.description:
Hey Challengers,

Hope you are all well and enjoying the Fall.

I am offering an Energy Transmission on Sunday Nights at 10PM, especially for weight loss!

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

This will also relax and strengthen your adrenal glands, and help to revitalize all of your glands and organs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

I will have this each and every Sunday at 10PM! And, in the comfort of your own home.

All you need to do is relax, and intend to receive the Weight Loss Energy Transmission from Jae.

It's that easy, and then you can just relax and enjoy! Do not worry about falling asleep, because the energies work great while you're sleeping. They will work even if you are distracted or if you forget.

All you need to do is to RSVP so that you are on the list.

Please RSVP for each week that want to be included so that I know you're in.

Hope you'll participate in the next Weight Loss Challenge in October!

I'd love to see you!

Hope to see you real soon!

 

All the very best,

Jae

results.description:
*** If you haven't joined our Facebook group yet, make sure you do! That's where a lot of the action happens: links to our photo albums, extra workouts, happy hours, random funny meme postings, you name it!

facebook.com/groups/therisenyc

----------------------------------------------

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Illustrate a song.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.
results.name: Weekly Photo Project - Illustrate a song

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
